name: Melanie Ogle
text: Just about every time I'm in need of things for home improvement,this is my 1st stop

name: Renorien
text: I went here to a few ship packages and afterwords called ups not only did they double the bill weight for the package, but it was .7 , .7 and .9 was charged as 2.0 for each instead of 1.0 they charged me $67.89  to ship three packages and the employee acted like she didn't care about customers. Extremely bad experience will never use again and I don't recommend anyone use them. I shipped the same 3 sized packages threw USPS for only $13.84.

resp.text:
We are not UPS.  We are a ship center and have no control over UPS rates.
UPS charges for the size of the box and its weight.  The post office will be less expensive most of the time and we frequently explain this to our patrons.  Understand again - we have no  control over the fees charged by UPS.  We are not a UPS store (they do have flexibility) we are just a local authorized ship center.  The person who waited on you was my Mother-in-law who was in some pain and overall not well.  Perhaps if you visit our location again I will be in the office and delighted to work with you.  I assure you Robbie Patterson is the nicest and most friendly person you would ever meet under normal circumstances.  We are sorry you had a bad experience.

name: Tyron Davis
text: Great customer service!!

name: James Baxter
text: Service could be better, friendlier.

name: S. Jacobi
text: They owe me money on Field Nation

resp.text: Do not know who S.Jacobi is and we deny that we owe anyone money on Field Nation.  This review is bogus.

name: Jason Morris
text: Good customer service very helpful

name: GARY Busby
text: Great place

name: Kimmie Dee
text:
Overall pleasant experience with this company!

The ladies in dispatch were friendly, professional, and very easy to talk to.Text messages and emails were sent out, keeping me informed about my job.

That said... My job was scheduled, but then cancelled last minute, on two different occasions. Both times were rescheduled for the following day - Which was not too bad.

On the day that my crew arrived, I was a little surprised that it turned out to be a 'one-man crew'; however, Fabio had a very impressive work ethic. He was a hard worker; knowledgeable & very committed to his line of work. He was also very neat, and cleaned up the debris, as he worked. I was amazed at how quickly & efficiently he completed the job, on his own!

Overall, I am very pleased with the job that was performed, and I absolutely love, love my new Home Depot floors!

I would recommend this business.

name: Maya Spivey
text: I had two installations scheduled. They called the day of installation and rescheduled on two separate occasions. Really unprofessional. Installation when they came out and did the carpet was great.

name: Dianna Moore
text: Excellent experience.   Very grateful Danny and his crew were assigned to install our new flooring.  Timely, courteous, informative and picked up after each area of floor was installed.  Didn't wait until job was done.  I couldn't have been more satisfied! Danny even called the day after job was complete to make sure everything was ok, nothing overlooked and everything was left to my satisfaction.  I would recommend Danny and his crew all day long!  I will also request them if I have any more project come up.

resp.text: Thank you, Dianna, for sharing your experience.  Enjoy! :)

name: Brenda Davidson
text:
Every aspect of our carpet installation was handled professionally from
initial contact to follow-up to installation.  The technicians were punctual and installed the carpet quickly and expertly.  We are very pleased.  We would definitely use them again.

resp.text: Thank you, Brenda, for sharing your experience.  Enjoy your beautiful new carpet! :)

name: Donna Simmons
text: I left a more detailed review on Yelp. It was to lengthy for Google. This company is unprofessional.  Needs to improve on their scheduling.  Come up with off the wall excuses for everything.  After months trying to get a carpet install finished (all left was install of a 3 ft transition piece)I gave up and called a local installer that put down my kitchen floor. Romanoff was supposed to along with the carpet. But I didn't trust them in my house after the carpet installation. Hire local if you can. This company is a joke. They were sent by Home Depot.

name: Kathy Scruggs
text: They arrived on time, worked really fast and consulted us frequently along the way to make sure to address any questions or concerns they had. I highly recommend Danny and his team. They were excellent.

resp.text: Thank you, Kathy, for sharing your experience.  Enjoy :)

name: Will S
text: I’ll say the actual carpet installers were great and thorough. But the company canceled on me twice last minute and I had to keep taking off work. They said they would send me home depot gift cards each time they canceled - never happened.

name: Thomas Michael
text: On time,worked til job was done and I was satisfied

resp.text: Thank you, Thomas, for sharing your experience.  Enjoy! :)

name: Jeff Aycock
text: Was supposed to have carpet installed in a condo in Homewood yesterday (9/16) - I live in Nashville. We had hidden a key for entry. Called 4 times and left messages - never heard back from anyone - so........... not sure if carpet was installed or not. How do you run a business without calling your customer back?

name: Mike Compton
text:
After receiving a text at 8:05 verifying that the installer would be there between 11 and 2, I received a text rescheduling for the following Monday.  After calling, I learned installer called in and said he would not be at work.  No one in your office bothered to let me know.
You don't deserve a zero.  I cancelled the whole job.

name: Rachel Olis
text: Romanoff did a great job! They communicated with us throughout the entire process and were punctual and professional. They did a great job - the only reason I am giving 4 stars over 5 is because our baseboards were scratched in the process of installation and we will need to touch them up. Otherwise we were very pleased!

name: Terry Bell
text: They installed our new flooring and we are very pleased with the results.  The guys were friendly and professional.  They cleaned up after finishing the job.  We couldn't have asked for more.

resp.text: Thank you, Terry, for sharing your experience.  Enjoy your new flooring :)

name: ricky jones
text: Day one of installation they were supposed to be there between 8 & 11 at 11:30 they texted and said my time had changed from 12 to 3, they didn’t show at all and didn’t even have the courtesy to call. They wouldn’t answer the phone, I left several messages which they never returned. That night they sent a text saying they would be there in the morning. We had to sleep on the floor since we cleaned everything out of the bedroom except the big furniture. He arrived a little after 9 with no help to move the furniture, I had to help him. It’s a good thing Adolfo did a good job or they would have gotten zero stars

name: Courtney Adams
text: Horrible customer service. Three times they were supposed to show up and didn’t. Just having them inspect my flooring from a previous flooring install they did that I’ve had nothing but problems out of. No way would I ever use them on my own but I’ve bought flooring through Home Depot and this is who they use. I will be sure to never recommend your company and tell everyone to not use them.

resp.text: Thank you, Chris, for sharing your experience with our team.  Enjoy the new flooring :)

name: Lisa Hall

text: Tom and Tommy were highly professional. Job was quick and efficient. Best part was Tom had helped me troubleshoot the water heater myself first to save me some money. Alas, the water heater truly needed replacing. They did well! Timely, respectful, and very pleasant to work with. Thank you both for your help!

name: bonner harris
text: I moved into a new house and immediately a pipe burst within a week of moving in! I went through 5 different plumbers trying to get the problem fixed and they would come over to “assess the problem” then proceed to tell me days or weeks later that I have to just repipe the whole house, and would lie to me by telling me that they couldn’t just fix the pipe because I wouldn’t be able to have water in other places of the house, or they would just simply never call or text me back! But it was a totally different story when I called TLT pluming, I called them around 3pm one afternoon and he was there at 9am the next day and fixed the problem after 3 months of not having hot water! I really wish I would have know to call them first! And the cost was a whole lot better than the 14 grand the other pluming company wanted from me to repipe my house!

name: April Deane
text: Tom was extremely helpful. Professional, on time, efficient,  and Excellent Work.  I will be using this company from now on!

name: Ashley Lynn
text: We had a water leak, they were very responsive, punctual, cordial, professional, they unclogged the drains, it was a huge help, didn't take long at all, roughly 30min. Didn't receive a quote beforehand so we were unprepared for the $300 price tag for service to run a snake thru & unclog but we had no choice as clear drains are crucial & a big priority for a household. Hard to put a price on something so significantly needed, not to mention, a chore we are definitely not qualified nor equipped to do ourselves. Overall, issue was repaired. We are satisfied. Would use again if needed. Would recommend as well.

name: Danielle White
text: Awesome service! They were at my house within a hour and fixed my toilet in 30 minutes! They had all the parts on hand. He was really friendly as well, definitely recommend!

text: I had a positive experience prior so hired Kevin again. I tried to reach him to make things right and could not reach him via phone or text. My flooring was cut incorrectly. I have numerous spots where you can see the slab. Toilets were not correctly re-installed. House was left a total mess. Floors were filthy, grout and sand and debris left in my sinks and tubs. Trim was not replaced where it belonged. Hole was made in my bedroom wall, was repaired, not great. I felt I was taken advantage of regarding charges to remove subfloor. I questioned the high rate and was told it was because it could take days, it took hours yet I wasn’t offered any relief.

name: Alex
text: Kevin is prompt and very professional. He arrived on time and notified me in advance when he would be here and what he would be doing. He tore out my old plastic master shower and tiled in a beautiful new one for me. The only negative is my water bill is going to go up because I love my shower now.10/10 highly recommended for tile in shower work.

name: Meredith Zywno
text: Kevin and his team recently replaced some laminate flooring in two rooms of our house with hardwoods. Kevin arrived on time and got the job done well within the expected timeline. He and his team were extremely courteous and professional, and his office manager was very easy to work with. We are very happy with how our floors turned out and will definitely be calling WCR in the future.

resp.text: Meredith, thank you so much for your positive review!

name: Dra Coleman
text: The quality of work is very poor.  The quality of work could have been mitigated if problems  we're shared with the owner when discovered.  You  can not suggest or make comments unless you pay for his and son mistakes.  This guy does not listen and have an answer for everything.  I would not recommend this company to anyone else.  I am having to hire someone else to correct his errors with the wood floors installed.

text: Kevin and his crew did an excellent job remodeling our bathtub into a walk in shower. He was kind enough, and patient enough, to work around our crazy hours and scheduling to get the job done. resp.text: Thank you Caryn for your kind words! It makes us happy that you are pleased with our work.

name: Ivy Heffelfinger

William Boggs

text: Omar was great to work with. He is a very honest and trustworthy person. He did a great job on our new vapor barrier and took care of a few issues while he was at it. Would highly recommend, and we are those "hard to please" customers.

resp.text: Brian, thank you for your kind words. I really do appreciate you and working with you was a breeze. Y’all are great people to work with!

name: denver betts
text: These guys are the greatest! They are honest they always give you more than what you pay for. They are they are prompt, courteous, on time when it comes to time of delivery, and have a great respect for your property. If your Builder was as good as these guys you would not have to call them to fix the problems. Highly recommend for any type of work that they contract to do!

text: I highly recommend HD Crawlspace Repair. They did extensive foundation work under our home. The price was reasonable. If we ever need more foundation work we will definitely call them back.

~HD Team

name: noella hall
text: The renovations done to our home could not be better. Everyone has gone above and beyond anything expected. It’s a great team of hard workers that do the work correctly. Thanks all for everything.

resp.text: Thank you! Glad to have helped out

name: Bruce Smith
text: Omar and his crew did an excellent job. They went beyond the encapsulation to do a needed repair the piers and floor joists. Omar did a great job of explaining each step  of the process

resp.text:
Hey Bruce,
I’m glad to hear you’re happy with the outcome of our teams work. We’re always happy to help.
Let us know if you need anything and Thank You so much.

name: Jason Quick
text: Omar and HD are amazing!  It is refreshing to find someone who combines skill, integrity and great customer service in providing the best for his customers. His knowledge and ability to take a project from idea to finished product and at a reasonable price makes Omar unique. I would highly recommend him to anyone seeking a true professional!

resp.text:
Hey Jason,
We appreciate your positive attitude and support. It’s always a pleasure working with you on your projects. Thank you so much!

Omar

name: Ruoxin Liu
text: Excellent service! Omar is a very friendly and helpful! He is very patient with all my house issues. They fixed my problems! Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Ruoxin

name: Henry Morgan
text: Outstanding service !!! Omar and Eric evaluated our floor problem and devised a solution to fix our uneven floors upstairs by putting in a 13 foot steel beam downstairs in the dinning room ceiling , and covered the beam with a design that looks like it’s always been part of the room . They quoted us a solid price that didn’t change and the job was completed in the time line quoted . When they  finished they cleaned up really well leaving us with a beautiful ceiling , covered beam  and Pilar that looked like it had always been there . Materials used were top quality and they took  good care not to damage our wood floor.  Extremely professional and trust worthy team .

resp.text: Henry, Thank you so much for the kind words. It is such a pleasure working with you and Sue. If you or your friends ever need anything we are at your service!

name: Kevin Davis
text: Omar is a very nice and polite person to deal with..excellent work and clean up job.. well pleased..

resp.text: Thank you Kevin, we always strive to make our clients happy!

name: Carlos M. Fernandez
text: Very nice, considerate and competitive in pricing.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Mitchell Plaxco
text: I was having moisture problems in a building I own. I knew it because of a musty smell that continued to worsen. I was really concerned because of the serious damage water can cause. Omar inspected my building and provided a thorough analysis of of what was causing the issue and how to remedy the problem. He was able to point out developing issues with my foundation I was unaware of and stop them from causing expensive damage. His team went above and beyond to fix my problem and make sure it did not return. Thank you guys so much.

resp.text: You are so welcome, thank you for calling us to remedy the situation. We truly appreciate you considering us first

name: Jerome Roberts
text: Michael and Drew came out to our house-30 minutes early-and found nothing wrong with our drain pipes. They both gave my wife and I peace of mind and didn’t try to rip us off with unnecessary work. I would HIGHLY recommend 911 plumbing and we will always be using them should the need arise. Thank you!!

name: Brett Coker
text: Great service and response time.  Kept me informed of when they were coming and were right on time.  Professional service from the office personnel and Drew, our plumber, was very thorough and professional.  Highly recommend this company.  Thanks Drew!!

name: Wayne Walker
text: Outstanding young man owns the company & is very conscientious about his work...honesty & integrity is important to Bret.  He came immediately to help me during a bit of a crisis, made the repair quickly & explained the issue thoroughly.  And in my opinion,  for a very good price.  I highly recommend calling 9-1 Plumb for any issues.

name: Glen Deal
text:
I called 9-1 Plumb on a Tuesday and made an after hours appointment for Thursday (all they had available at the time). I told the "dispatcher" Renee (sp?) that I had a water meter ripped out of the ground by Hurricane Sally and that I needed new meter re-installed in ground, hooked and entire new line ran to house. Requested that if anything opened up between Tuesday and Thursday to notify me.

Thursday morning Brent contacted me and said he would scope out the job and call me back. Within 15 minutes he called with a description and plan to solve the issue and that his crew (Drew and Nolan) could be onsite within an hour or so and complete the entire job by end of day.

Drew and Nolan arrived as scheduled with all necessary equipment (to include trencher) to complete the job and restore services to my home.

All of the members of 9-1 Plumb, Brent, Drew, Nolan and Renee were exceptionally professional, friendly, timely and most of all - customer service oriented.

I couldn't have asked for better.

We very much appreciate their work and most highly recommend them!!!! They will be my first call for any future issues!!!!

name: Mitch Pinkston
text:
If you are looking for a fair, honest, and professional plumber, call 9-1 Plumb.

Brent, the master plumber, explains every step of the repair process, and he ensures that the job is done in a timely fashion.  Due to poor pipes used by the homebuilder 10 years ago, our house experienced multiple leaks last fall.  Brent responded within a couple of hours of our call and was able to locate and repair the issues.  Eventually, 9-1 Plumb completed a re-pipe of our house.  We received multiple bids, and they completed the re-pipe in a quick and clean manner while also being the most cost-effective option for me.

This week our original grinder pump stopped working when it met its life expectancy (10 years).  Brent thoroughly checked every part of the grinder pump system to try to find the least costly repair.  Unfortunately, the pump was shot and a replacement was needed.  Brent was able to have a new pump and assembly installed the very next day.

I will call Brent at 9-1 Plumb for all of my plumbing needs.

name: Coy Buckley
text: Prompt service and great commmuncation by Lisa and the team. Thank you!

name: Deb T
text: Called and spoke with Brent for a leaking hot water heater. He told me what to do until he could get here. Professional, caring and quality service. Integrity pretty much sums it up. Thank you!

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to give us your review.  We strive for excellence in everything we do.  It is truly our customers that make our jobs worthwhile.  We are here if you need us!
The staff at 9-1 Plumb

name: Nicole Michaels
text: Friendly staff and fantastic prices.

name: Teresa Kidd
text: Definitely recommend 9-1 Plumb. Very quick service and our call was late afternoon. Professional, courteous and friendly. Had our plumbing problem solved quickly. Will certainly call Doug Mitchell for any future plumbing issues.

name: Stan Stabler
text: 9-1 Plumb exceeded my expectations. They were very helpful and did a great job. They ripped out an existing shower and installed a new culture marble showers. All the workers were very nice and polite and always left the job site clean. I highly recommend this company.  If I have plumbing needs in the future they will be the one I call.

name: Paulette Bullin
text: Replaced my outdoor leaking faucet and it hasn't leaked since :) Brent and Chandler were true professionals, knew exactly what to do and did a great job. They arrived the same day I called and seemed it didn't take very long for them to do the repair. By the way and very important, the price for the work was reasonable. Highly recommend.

name: Debra Mahanay
text: The whole experience was great.  Kind receptionist and excellent service.  Reasonable price.  Will recommend and definitely call for future needs .

resp.text: On the behalf of our staff at 9-1 Plumb we want to thank you for your great review.  We strive for excellence in every aspect of our company.  It is our customers that make this all worth while.  Thank you for your business.

name: David Chew
text: We had a clogged toilet drain in our master bath. It has been backing up about once a month for a while. These guys came in and got to work right away. They did not stop until the drain was clear. They went through the toilet first, then the sink, then the shower, and then back through the toilet, and then up through the clean out located on the outside of the house. After all of that they went back to their office and pick up the "BIG" machine. Once they got back they ran it once through the toilet drain where it ran into the clog and cut through the major clog and clearing the pipe. We watched at the outside clean out as the nasty clog pushed on through and out to the sewer. Then we saw nothing but clear water after that. No problems since then.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us such a positive review.  We understand our customers concerns and try to take care of them in a professional and timely manner.  We are here if you need us.

name: Samantha Pinkston
text: I can't say enough good things about Brent and D.  I called 9-1 Plumb when we had water coming up through our hardwood floor. The dispatcher initially said they wouldn't be able to get to us until the next day, but called when they had an opening later in the day since I had mentioned I wanted same day. We had a different plumber out earlier who told us at best we were going to need a costly repair or at worst would need to redo the plumbing in the entire house.  When the source of the leak wasn't obvious, Brent was thorough in figuring out what was actually leaking and was able to do the repair easily and for a very reasonable price. 9-1-Plumb saved us thousands of dollars. I highly recommend and will use them for all our future plumbing needs.

We just moved in our new home and woke up with plumbing issues with two small children. Lisa and Daniel went above and beyond to accommodate us quickly. Jennifer Allbritain

name: Georgia Brown
text: I would highly recommend this company!! I had what I thought was a leaking water heater in my rental house. Water was getting under the laminate flooring. I called Doug after hours. He answered promptly and answered all my questions and said he could come the next day. My renter and I had shut off and drained the water heater. He was there at the time he promised with his co worker Jeff.  They discovered I actually had a slab leak! He gave me a quote that was much less than I expected and said they could start the next day. Brent and Jake came the next morning on time and ready to work. They worked all day with only a short break. They were courteous and professional and also very neat and respectful and careful not to disturb my renter's personal belongings. The job was a 2 day job and they came first thing the next morning to complete their work and worked this day until they finished without taking a break. They showed and explained to me everything they had done. You could hardly tell there had been any work done at all, everything was so clean!! Sorry to write a book, but having these guys do this job made a very stressful situation much less so!! I can't praise them enough and they will definitely get my business in the future!!  Georgia B.  Fairhope, Al

name: Marissa Thetford
text:
We've used Doug and his team twice and have had a great experience both times.

The first time he repaired a leak in the laundry room behind our washer which caused flooding into our kitchen. He responded quickly, after hours (at night on a weekend), and dina great job.

Today we called on him again to install a garbage disposal in our kitchen and check a leak behind our master bathroom toilet. The disposal was easy, but the bathroom was a bit trickier since he didn't know what he would find behind the wall. He walked me through the steps he was taking and provided a price range based on what he might find once he got started which was helpful. (That way we knew what the high end might be if damage was extensive or the repair was more complex than anticipated.) Thankfully, it wasn't as bad as it could have been and itwas easily fixed in one visit.

The 9-1 team is on time, professional, and affordable. Doug and his team were also very clean while working on the repairs which was much appreciated. I'd strongly reccomend the 9-1 team to anyone in the area looking for a reliable plumbing team.

text: I am more than satisfied with the work Klein Plumbing did for me today.  Their workers Blake and Drew are top notch.  They fixed two tubs, a sink, a toilet, and a garbage disposal all in an hour an a half.  While they were here I asked them to look at the toilet and garbage disposal and they fixed them no problem.  I originally called around looking for a plumber to fix the tub and sink and was quoted for around $200-250.  Klein charges by the hour, but they work fast to make sure they get the job done as quickly as possible.  Even with adding the extra fixes, they would have been cheaper than the other quotes I got for just the tub and sink.  The only reason I ended up paying more than $200 is because I needed a new garbage disposal.  I would most definitely recommend Klein Plumbing to anyone looking for a plumber.  I know they will be the people I call for any future plumbing work needed.

text: Incredibly rude staff.  Totally dismissive during my call.  I would recommend you look elsewhere as I have.

name: Theodore Chandler
text:
Fails to deliver. Possibility of being ghosted.

TLDR:
Request patch on back porch to prevent further floor joist damage
Company patches hole but it fails to seal against water leaks
Request company come back to fix patch
Company fails to deliver. Instead stops all contact with customer.

I accepted a proposal to repair a leak on my back porch and fix a floor joist which had been rotting due to the leak.
Work took place on February 20th while I was out of town. The floor joist was successfully repaired. Unfortunately when I got back and poured some water over the patch I found that it still allowed water onto the support.
I contacted the business owner (Devin Lanier) on February 25 by text message and by email on February 27th.
The business owner replied via email the next day stating "So sorry about that. Let me look at our schedule and I will get someone back out there to check it out ASAP".
The company scheduled an appointment for Sunday March 3rd to look at the leak. A storm came through the area on the day they were scheduled and I understand it would not have been possible for them to come out. Unfortunately no cancellation notice was communicated to me.
I reached back out by email on March 4th to ask again for someone to check on the leak and I was told "Yes a few of my guys were caught up up with the weather. Let me look at our schedule this week and try to get someone to cut loose and head over there. I’ll let you know. "

Since the email on the March 4th I have not received any contact from the company. I have tried many avenues of contact without success.
Including emails on March 9th, March 14th, March 18th and March 28th.
Phone calls to both the main number requesting call backs and the estimator number. None of which have been returned

Rachel Hunter
Marketing & Business Development
Bama Exterminating

name: Carol Lee
text: We signed up for quarterly pest control because the house already had an existing termite contract with them. After the first spray, we kept getting earwigs (like 1 a day) inside the house (half of the time they were very much alive). We called and they sprayed again. It didn't stop the earwigs. Second spraying comes around and same thing- earwigs inside every day. This time when we contacted them (2 weeks ago), they ignored us. They also didn't call when they came to spray the second time so if hadn't been home, he wouldn't have been able to get inside or in the backyard. We signed a year contract and I'm not sure what it would take to get out of that. But signing a contract should have been a signal they were bad. Good results don't require a contract to keep people stuck. Be aware of the contact too- it only covers a very limited amount of pests.

name: Brittany Clayton
text: Quick to come out and handle any issues in between regular services.

name: Catherine Lee
text: My roommate and I had a terrible experience with this company. To start, the employee sprayed the wrong house the first time we made an appointment. This was very inconvenient for my roommate and I to figure out another time to have the guy come spray our house. Once we got home after finally having our house sprayed, we noticed some of our belongings had been gone through. There was jewelry rearranged, purses opened, and a ring was lying in the hallway by the kitchen. We were very confused because the only person who had been in our house that day was the exterminator. We looked through our belongings and came to find that a Michael Kors watch was missing (est. $225), Apple T.V (est. $100+),  jewelry (est. $600+), and cash. We are not explicitly accusing anyone of stealing, but we have high suspicions because the exterminator was the only one in the house that day. Keep in mind that it was required for everyone in the house to evacuate during the spraying procedure. We are extremely violated and hope this does not happen to anyone else.

text: My company has used their services for years. We love the great managerial staff, and the technicians we've had have always been willing to work with us and our tenants. I'd suggest them to anyone!

text: Bama Exterminating is the best pest control in town, hands down. They're organized enough to handle a heavy workload, but small enough to focus on their customers & provide great service. Good people at Bama. Would recommend them to my own mother!

name: Jeanette Haley
text: My experience with Bama has been very good.  The people sent to our home have been prompt, professional, courteous and helpful.  We have been pleased with the service.

name: Pam Sewell
text:
We have used Bama for about 15 years (in 3 different houses).  Nice techs that come to my house. Have rarely seen a live "bug" inside the house - but if I do and it's not time for the next quarterly service, I call them and they come out and re-spray at no charge.
We recently moved (about 4 months ago) and, though, still in a neighborhood, this time our house backs up to woods instead of a neighbor's house.  We had ticks and "critters" in the yard everywhere! - some I had never seen before in my life! Carly came and did a TOTAL inside and outside spray (the entire yard!) before we started the quarterly service at this house.  Bugs and ticks are GONE! Wheee!  I still see an occasional 'millipede' (sp?) but I think as we continue the quarterly service, they will disappear too (they are rough ole hard-shelled critters!). 4 Thumbs Up! ;-)

name: Alex Seiver
text: I had an absolutely fantastic experience with Bama Exterminating Co. - the team that came do perform the termite protection on my home were punctual, friendly, courteous, professional, and above all, did a great job! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Bama Exterminating to anyone looking for pest and termite protection.

name: Britt Marshall
text: Have been using their services for many years.  Have always been extremely happy with their thoroughness, their hospitality and their professionalism.  If you are in need of termite bond or pest control services, you should use them.

name: Delmar Thomas
text:
I had Bama Exterminating for a few years until I ran into some problems with them being sloppy.  I live out of state, but used them for my second home in AL.  I specifically asked them from the beginning to put my primary out-of-state home address as the billing contact.  For years, they would conduct the service and send the bill to my primary address out of state.  I always immediately paid for their services via credit card over the phone.  For my annual ant and terminate inspections this year, I just happen to call them to schedule things, and they said, "we closed your account because of failure to make a payment."  ???  I told them I never received a bill nor knew there was an outstanding balance.  I asked what the billing address was...never got a straight answer.  Eventually, the phone representative admitted to the possibility that Bama may have sent it to the AL home where the service was being performed.  Also not true, because my mom lives there and sends me all bills that come to the house.  The phone rep even had the nerve to say "we were sending the account to collections."  I never even knew there was a bill due!  And they obviously make no attempts on their end to keep in touch with the customer.  That was issue No. 1.  Nonetheless, I immediately paid the outstanding balance and that issue was resolved, despite Bama's sloppiness and failure to communicate.

Issue No 2., they have an absolutely unconscionable provision in their agreement that says something to the effect of, "Customer must give 30 days written notice before getting out the the Agreement."  The very next sentence in the Agreement says, "Bama may cancel the contact without notice at any time for any reason."  What?!

Besides the fact that such a provision would never hold up in court if there ever were a dispute, it is a completely onerous clause.  They're not selling gold, they spraying chemicals on the ground, for goodness sake.  No need for such an unfair clause.  I asked the representative for a reason for such an unfair clause.  She responded something to the effect of, "we need that in there for customers who don't pay."  What????  Well, in my opinion, such language is waaaay over broad for such a limited scenario as nonpayment.  Anyway, I refused to agree to it, Bama Exterminating refused to change or delete it, and we parted ways.  I signed up the same day with their competitor, who actually ended up being cheaper...and more organized as well.  I have been happy so far.

There is a fine line between a mom and pop operation and a sloppy operation.

name: leslie crawford
text: Wont use bama exterminators again. They are liars. Say one thing and do another.

resp.text: Hello Leslie, we are so sorry you have had a negative experience with us. We aim to provide superior pest control services to our clients and to always be upfront about all aspects of our business and services. To ensure we are maintaining this level of superior service we keep very detailed records of all interactions with our team. We will review your account and reach out to you if any additional information is needed to resolve this matter. Please feel free to call us anytime you have questions.

text: Courteous and professional, not to mention prompt.  Service was excellent.

name: Dr. Lindsay Greenlee
text:
This company is unprofessional and their customer service is severely lacking.  In my case, they made several mistakes and refused to admit to or even rectify their own mistakes.  I purchased my home four years ago and it came with a termite bond with Bama Exterminating.  This year (2014) they mailed me a contract to sign regarding that termite bond with dates listed from 2012 to 2014.  In essence, because they made a mistake and did not have me sign a contract when I purchased the home, they were trying to get me to agree to terms for the previous years to cover themselves legally while disregarding the legal issues for the customer.
I called their office manager, Kim Ousley, to inquire about this contract and she was unable to explain why I was receiving this contract four years after the home purchase and why the contract had a start date listed as 2012.  After getting frustrated with my questioning and being unable to answer the questions posed to her, she hung up the phone.
Then, I spoke with another employee, Mr. Bridges, who did manage to explain at least why I was receiving this contract at the time I did.  However, he did not see any issue with me agreeing to terms, in writing, that were two years in the past.  He also did not see any issue with Ms. Ousley's behavior even though she was unable to explain their contract and hung up on a customer after getting flustered.
So, there are a serious of problems here that are all the mistake of Bama Exterminating and the company refused to rectify their mistake.  First, they should obtain a new contract when homes are sold for the new owner.  They failed to do that in my case.  When they realized their mistake (in 2012), they continued to let the contract go unsigned.  In 2014, they mailed a letter and a contract dated for 2012.  In the letter they stated they could not renew my termite bond UNLESS I signed the back-dated contract.  This seems reasonable except the mistake was on their end and I shouldn't be required to sign things I am uncomfortable signing and they refused to fix it.  I offered to sign a current contract but they would not do that unless I signed the back-dated one.  Finally, the way the office manager, Ms. Ousley, handled the call was unfortunate.  If she did not have the proper information or could not communicate effectively with the customer, she should have found someone else to help rather than hang up the phone on a long-term customer.
In sum, there were multiple errors made this company and even after I offered to sign a current contract, they refused to fix their mistake or even take responsibility.  I would not recommend doing business with this company until they refine their business practices.  There are many more companies that offer the same type of services and will offer better customer service.

***Update - I hired their competitor for half the cost yearly and I would suggest doing that.  From what I have learned about pest control, Bama Exterminating is using older bait stations which is why they need to come service them four times a year.  Companies that use more modern equipment are lower cost because the stations need to be serviced less often.

resp.text:
Good evening Juana, I want to apologize for the incident earlier. I felt bad for making that Mistake and almost causing an accident. I told my employees I know I scared whoever was in the vehicle and I actually said sorry and threw my hand up (even though you couldn't see me or hear me). I have children too, so I know the feeling even if it wasn't children involved everyone's life is precious and
valuable. I'm sorry for that.  I wasn't on the phone nor was I speeding I was coming on to the highway off the bypass my lane was running out I was near the end a truck had moved over, so I started to move over as well to get on to the highway and you were in my blind spot I didn't see you. I am not a reckless driver nor would I ever risk lives intentionally, i didn't see you in my blind spot I looked twice and was seeing my lane running out, so when the truck moved over to let me in that's when I proceeded to move over not knowing you were back there. I'm happy everyone was and is safe. I do understand your frustration, I would've been to and have been in that situation before. However, I do truly feel you can forgive me for a mistake like I forgave them.

text: Incredible installation of crawlspace encapsulation, however our factory new sump pump had a faulty switch. Aqua-Guard responded the next day and replaced the entire pump. I never write reviews but felt i should for these guys. They really helped us out with our flood water issues.

name: Brook Armistead
text: We had them scheduled for our waterproofing and we had a contractor come in and do the demolition in our main bathroom. We tried to contact them multiple times over the course of two weeks and never got a response. By the time we finally heard back from them it was the day before our scheduled appointment to have them come in and do the waterproofing and they said there was more our contractor needed to do. They had to push out our date and put us at the back of the line even though they are the ones that did not respond to our multiple calls. Therefore we have decided to go with Bdry instead. Mike NEVER returned our calls once he sold the job!!

resp.text: We respectfully disagree with this complaint.  I met with Mr. Patel (I have never met Brook Armistead and she was not present) on 4-9-2021 to provide him with a quote (approximately 8 weeks prior to installation date).  It is my understanding that Brook Armistead is Mr. Patel's wife.  At that time, I went over in detail what prep work would need to be done in order for us to install our waterproofing system.  I informed Mr. Patel that I would be glad to provide him with a contractor that could do the prep work properly, he chose to use his own contractor.  Mr. Patel and I had several conversations leading up to the date of the installation about specifics of the job.  The statement that I never returned phone calls is patently false.  Mr. Patel has had several conversations with our office as well, to which his phone calls were always answered or returned (records to prove it).  Our office called to confirm the installation date on June 3rd, at which time Tina went over everything that needed to be moved again.  I spoke with Mr. Patel on Monday, June 7, TWO days prior to installation date of June 9. It was at this time I discovered Mr. Patel had been misinformed by his contractor about what needed and didn't need to be removed.  Aqua-Guard only removed Mr. Patel from the schedule when he wanted us to postpone his job.  In that conversation our office manager explained to him that if he postponed the job that we are booked out and couldn't guarantee when he could be worked back into the schedule.  He called us back on June 10 to get back on the schedule and we were unable to give him an immediate schedule date. We were in the process of shuffling our schedule to work him back in when Mr. Patel called our office today upset and cancelled the project all together.  We were not going to put him at the back of the line.  We regret the homeowner feels this way but we feel we did everything we could to accommodate them.

name: Laine White
text: Emmanuel was so wonderful and we had the best experience with him! It’s so hard to find people who are wonderful to work with these days, and he helped us with our water issue and was a pleasure to do business with. Cant recommend him enough!

text: They did a phenomenal job waterproofing my basement.  The employees were all courteous, professional and on time.  The work was perfect and is functioning as advertised.  Would absolutely recommend them!

name: Dylan Scroggins
text: I think I earned a Masters degree in encapsulation/water-proofing due to all the research I put into the job I needed and who to go with. After having AquaGuard complete our crawlspace I can assure you that they are the best in the business. I was VERY impressed with the professionalism and quality of their work from every member of their team. From the front office to the front lines they are good people that do great work. Highly suggest!

name: Mick McGrath
text: They were very accommodating,  and do great work!

name: Jill Rogers
text:
2nd Update -
AquaGuard returned to make repairs as needed and did an excellent job. They were very apologetic for the issues we experienced and did everything they could to make up for it. Because of this, I cannot recommend them enough, they were extremely professional and handled the situation with ease. They came out immediately to fix the issues and I wouldn't hesitate to hire them again if we ever need to. Very grateful to Manny and Tina for their help!

They installed a sump pump and an excellent waterproofing system in our basement for the previous owners who lived here. We contacted AquaGuard to redirect one of the discharge lines and they quoted us a reasonable price, so we decided to have them do it. It took several calls to get them to come out, and they finally came out about 4 months later. The guys who did the work didn’t cap the sewage line, so I called them and asked if they could come back as it should only take a few minutes. Well I wasn’t surprised when they didn’t so I just went to Home Depot and purchased what I needed. Overall, quality of work was good (besides not capping the sewage pipe back).
1st Update: Went to the basement this morning to discover that the guys working had broken the drainage pipe for our bathroom sink and they used a Romex power wire we have running in the basement to hang their new pipe on. Will update review if AquaGuard returns to fix the issue.

name: Robert Carver
text: Very pleased with Aqua-Guard's work. Mike was good to work with, and the installation team did a great job. Because of my general interest in the approach I observed the entire process. The install team clearly knew what they were doing, and functioned together like a well-oiled machine. In some areas they exceeded my expectations. Good estimation process, good installation, and good price. I recommend without hesitation.

name: Ryan H
text: Aquaguard was fantastic throughout the entire process. Mike was very easy to work with and did a great job addressing all concerns. We had several companies come out and quote the job and as it so rarely turns out these guys had the lowest price as well as the most intelligent solution. One of the other companies wanted to sell us a similar system with an unnecessary pump system for almost twice the price of AG. Due to our property being on a heavy slope it made more sense to have the water gravity fed from the basement to have one less thing to worry about maintaining. Mike saw the reason in this approach and explained while some applications do require a pump ours did not and so was able to design the system to accommodate our individual situation as opposed to saying “This is our system. It’s the same for everyone”. On the day of the job the crew showed up on time with a supervisor to address any concerns before starting the job. Everything was completed and cleaned up in a matter of hours. They didn’t leave a mess and did exactly what they said they would. Tough to find these days, especially at a reasonable price!!  I would highly recommend this company. Not only did they knock it out of the park installing a water proofing system that is working like a champ but also offer a warranty for the life of the structure which is as good or better than anything else I was able to find while researching how to solve the water issue. Thanks guys for a great experience well worth the money!!!

name: Jodie Mote
text: Mike/Aqua Guard was great to work with and did a great job with our crawl space encapsulation.  It immediately helped with our temperature issues and gave us a ton of additional storage.  They recommended an option much cheaper than another company who appeared to be trying to sell me a lot of stuff I didn't need for my intended use.

name: Farrah Mote
text: Aqua-Guard was highly recommended to me by numerous people. They lived up to their recommendation with their quality of work, quick turnaround and professionalism. Mike provided the perfect solution for our crawl space and a quote that was much less than others. I highly recommend Aqua-Guard for your waterproofing needs.

name: Scott McGriff
text:
We used Aquaguard 3 years ago (2016) to waterproof a finished room on the lower level of our home.  The process they use has kept us from having any water intrusions since and we no longer have even a hint of the musty smell that we had been dealing with for years.

I would definitely recommend their product/service.

name: Marion Yester
text:
In 2011 we moved into an older home on a beautiful small lake.
In 2012 our area experienced an unprecedented amount of rain and we were surprised to find that water was accumulating along the back wall of the workshop. We called several companies in Birmingham and got their suggestions as well as estimates.  Aqua-Guard impressed us with their range of options, their patience and a more reasonable price.  They came out and put in one of their systems and we have had no trouble in that area since.
In 2016 we again had a tremendous amount of rain and this time, water came in on the other side of the house.  We, of course called Aqua-Guard and were pleased to find out that they could extend the system to include the new section.  They even let us do some of the prep work and saved us money!
In 2018, again a lot of rain and water was coming in near the corner of the workshop door.  We worked with Aqua-Guard to do some problem solving.  For a few weeks it was a mystery.  They never gave up. But then Mike Shofner and my husband came up with a very creative solution.  We could not be happier.
If any other water problem should arise, we would never consider calling anyone other than Mike and Aqua-Guard.  They get our strongest recommendation and would encourage others to give them a call!

name: Andrew Golson
text: Very professional.  Their quote was $5k+ less than their competitor and significantly less invasive.  The system works perfectly and their team was fast and efficient.  Lifetime guarantee on their work as well.  Brett their sales manager came back out personally and adjusted something to my liking.  Would highly recommend.

name: harrykat 0ne
text:
This is one great company, they did the work promptly and the quality of their work is way above average! Very trained and professional crew who did an outstanding job! No complaints at all, would highly recommend!
Jeff Rominger..Hoover

name: trevor lundstrom
text:
We dealt with Mike the owner of Aquaguard.  I had a quote from a competitor that was several thousand dollars more expensive.  Mike looked at their quote said he would do same thing for considerably less, roughly half price.  He was also more professional and was present during the start of the job unlike the other company who schedules subcontractors to install their product.  I always prefer to deal with family owned companies for better customer service and pricing.

He supervised the job and coordinated an inexpensive electrician to remove the fuse box from the garage wall, and install outlet.  The entire job was finished in a half day and they cleaned up after themselves.  The lifetime warranty is another added benefit.  You will not go wrong with Aquaguard.  Get their free estimate and see for yourself.

name: Thomas Glover
text: Just had our first big rain of the year. Normally, we would water leaking through the walks but we had aqua guard come out and put in a system to keep the water out of the garage and basement. Hard working crew. Very professional and lowest price.

name: Chris Williams
text: Misrepresentation of the scope of the job.  Bad communication from the get go.Didn’t call just showed up when they wanted.  Customer service didn’t  mind the crew cutting an electrical cord in my wall and then just swiping electrical tape over it( very dangerous). Overall did not come out to understand my concerns or care about them at all. Poor poor poor customer service and communication.

resp.text: I am very sorry you feel this way, but I would like to address the issues listed.  I communicated with you about the wall clearance and what needed to be done prior to us doing the work. A copy of the contract was left with you on the day of the estimate that listed the work that needed to be done in order for us to waterproof your basement. This quote was given 4 months before you called to schedule the project.  Our office called you the week before your scheduled project to confirm the appointment and an approximate time the crew would arrive.  Our communication is the same with all of our customers.  On the day of the appointment you signed the contract that listed prep work that needed to be done and it was explained to you again on the day of the job.  Our crew did the prep work for you, which was your responsibility, at no additional cost to you. It is extremely important to me to keep our reputation and customer satisfaction at the highest level possible. I am not sure what we could have done differently to communicate to you about your project and what needed to be done.  I have reached out to you with no response.  I am not sure what more I can do to help you.

name: David Shaw
text: Mike and his crew did an amazing job waterproofing our basement.  Very professional, great price and done on time.

name: Ken
text: The Aqua-Guard Team was on time, efficient, and hard-working.  Thanks to Mike, Tina, Brett, and the Installation Techs for the value add to our home!!

name: The Aubins
text:
Aquaguard installed a waterproofing in my basement and encapsulation in my crawl space 2.5 years ago. The GOOD: The price was very competitive, Mike (owner) seemed very honest detailing the work to be performed, the crew completed the job quickly, and I haven’t had any water intrusion issues since. THE BAD: following the completion of the job I noticed several items that looked suspect - caulking around door, window, fireplace, and at end of wall sheets was missing or poorly done, sump basin cover had a large cutout and therefore not well sealed, encapsulation in crawl space was made up of what looked like a lot of scrap peices haphazardly taped together and noticeable creases in the tape joints. I didn’t call Mike to come back out because I figured they were the pros and the installation methods were acceptable and/or industry standard - i.e not items I should be concern about. Well... 2.5 yrs later, I’m having issues with the tape joints separating and releasing moisture and foul odors from the soil gases escaping the encapsulation in my crawl space that are coming up into our main level. I contacted Aquaguard and was told that it’s been too long since the install for them to correct the problem free of charge. the customer service representative basically stated that “if the waterproofing system isn’t leaking then it doesn’t fall under their warranty.” So much for standing behind your work. If the encapsulation membrane would have been taped correctly we would not be having this issue. Note* I have already addressed the poor caulking and sump basin lid on my own as to not be a “needy customer”.

Interesting bit of info... I called BDry about this as I thought they had done the waterproofing. They sent a rep out the next day, he checked the encapsulated crawl space, agreed it was not installed acceptably, and said they would be sending someone out to correct the problem before end of week. Unfortunately, I’ve realized they didn’t perform the work originally so I called them off.

name: Tracy Thornton
text: Awesome company!!! Would recommend to anyone!!!

name: Terry Gregory
text: We have been loyal customers since 2005 and at that time they were a small company with great support and a great product. Things sure have changed. They changed the product so that it is not as responsive and to have it altered to work better, they charge you $100. That is fine, however they expect you to send the entire device at your own expense. We use to be able to call and talk directly to the owner about any issues that may arise from time to time but not anymore. We asked his secretary to have him give us a call and that's when things got heated. He called back in a very nasty manner and was very short with me. I was  shocked as we have been doing business with him for 15 years. It certainly goes to show how success can go to some people's heads. I'm done.

text: Our installers were Murray & Tony and they did an awesome job!  They were very professional and courteous and called ahead of time to let us know that they would be arriving a little early - which was fine with us. When they arrived they told us how the process would work and they did a great job being very careful with how they moved out the larger furniture items. The carpet looks awesome and it feels even better on our feet!  Couldn’t be happier with how Murray and Tony did the job!

text: It was a great value for the dollar spent. I believe I got MORE than I paid for in service, communication and work quality. The kept me informed every step of the way. Honored all my requests, were on time and very professional. The job was done EXACTLY as I would have expected and then some. Very nice and patient with me (I can ask a lot of questions) and the ANSWERED all of them. I will most definitely use this place for ANY and EVERY home project I need done. It is refreshing to know a place still cares about the customer 1st, then the $$$. And here is a secret, if you do that the $$$ will come! Yes, VERY SATISFIED and I HIGHLY suggest you pick them as well, you will not be disappointed.

text: Forrest, Katelyn, and Xavier did a superb job. They did a professional installation of our Luxury Vinyl Tile. Thanks for a job well done!

name: Paula Pace
text: The installers did an excellent job and left my house very clean. I would recommend them to anyone .

name: Oneika Moore
text: This entire process has been a nightmare. We purchased materials through Home Depot and they assigned this group. From the initial scheduling to today- it’s been a mess. Our home has been in disarray for well over a month. At first it was- oh we didn’t know you had wood and carpet- the wood should go first. (Umm you scheduled it, how should I know- we just spent thousands on flooring for YOU to know) then we get Home Depot not ordering enough wood- installer has a medical problem, you’re on the schedule, but it’s tentative. Then add Tammy/Tracy “country bumpkin” Site Manager’s attitude trying to tell us exactly how many boards are left to do like she’s been in the house. Totally unprofessional group- if Home Depot ever assigns these people to do your work- SKIP IT! The actual installer guys were nice-but the management is SUBSTANDARD.

name: Edwin Rivera
text: People at Romanoff kept in touch along the way. Before the institution they called me to explain everything. They also sent me various emails confirming the day, carpet pattern and type of patting. My appointment was changed for two days prior to the original day, not before calling me and getting my approval. Very professional staff and excellent job.

resp.text: Thank you, Edwin, for taking the time to share your experience!  Enjoy your new flooring :)

We got 3 bedrooms and their associates closets done. They did a great job laying the carpet. If there are seams, I cannot tell where they are.

We can't say enough about Romanoff Renovations. They really strive to do the best job possible for there customers. Lori from the Auburn Team always kept us informed about install date and is quick to respond to any questions or concerns. Their installers  (Daniel) really know their stuff. This is a very professionally run company.
Thanks

text: My floor installers were both professional, quick and cleaned up afterwards. Thank you Forrest for such an AWESOME Job. The carpet looks and feels better than what we expected.

name: Julie Melton
text: The guys showed up earlier in the time window we were given. They were thorough and friendly. Our carpet looks really good!

resp.text: Thank you, Julie, for sharing your experience.  Enjoy your new carpet :)

name: Lisa Lovvorn
text: They were professional and efficient. They did a quick job removing the old carpet and installed the new in a timely manner. They even cleaned up and vacuumed after. Very pleased with their work.

name: Derek Herscovici
text:
The first thing that let me know I had picked the right general contractor was Jordan Latimer’s attention to detail. Other GC’s weren’t willing to take the extra measurements, or recommend quality parts, or go the extra mile to make sure this project was done right.
When the renovation process began, he communicated the process every step of the way. He let me know where there were issues and promptly set about fixing them with almost no time lost. He helped me achieve my vision for this bathroom and shower remodel and brought in a team of specialists and experts to see it through to completion. He does nothing halfway and values your input too, instead of overriding your ideas. I have gotten to know Jordan a lot during this process, and he is not only a fabulous contractor, but a man of great heart and compassion. He understands people as well as he does home remodeling and does not skimp on either. I cannot reccomend him enough. YOU WILL NEVER NEED ANOTHER CONTRACTOR AGAIN.

resp.text: Thank you Derek! That was very kind of you to say those words. I take a lot of pride in my work and I will never take a shortcut to jeopardize the integrity of a job. It has been wonderful getting to know you and I look forward to the continuing work we have going forward from here. Once again your kind words are very much appreciated.

name: Anthony Spina
text: Jordan is a top notch contractor. He went well out of his way to make sure all of our needs were taken care of. He even fixed things we never asked him to fix at no additional cost. Jordan is a perfectionist and pays attention to every detail of his work. I would highly recommend him.

resp.text: Anthony, thank you so much for the kind words! I really enjoyed working for your great family and if you ever need us we are always here for you. Thanks again!

name: Ben Burnett
text: Jordan and his crew did a magnificent job.  Jordan is a honest guy, and his attention to detail in his work is second to none.  I trust him and his craftsmanship.  I knew it from the first time he came to do an estimate.  I would not want anybody else to do my work.  Our kitchen that they did is really beyond words.

resp.text: Thank you so much Ben! We are so very thrilled to know that y’all are happy with the kitchen. Looking forward to the future jobs and will get you guys some adjusted numbers just as soon as we can.

name: Tracy Witte
text: Jordan does excellent work and really prides himself in getting a job done correctly. We have hired his company for several jobs over the past 4 years and have always been extremely pleased with his work.  Unlike many local contractors, who are hard to track down, Jordan communicates so well, which makes it easy to work with him. He is *so* responsive by phone, text, etc. We recommend him highly to all of our local friends and will hire him again in a heartbeat for any future repairs/remodeling.

resp.text: Tracy, we are so thrilled that you are happy with the outcome of your new front door. It goes so well with everything on the house and this whole project has been a major transformation. You guys are some of my favorite people to work for and thank you so much for the kind words!!

text: Jordan recently did a countertop installation for us.  It was not a huge job but did require some creativity and ingenuity for this particular job. We are ready for him to do our next job.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Sforzini! We really appreciate the kind words and we will get you an estimate for the next job as soon as we are able.

name: Belle Winful
text: I don' t even know where to begin with this review. I wish I could provide all pictures of our home before and after the complete renovation to see how amazing of a job that was done. JL Remodeling & Home Repair made our home more beautiful than we even envisioned. What I love most about Jordan, the owner, is that he will not improvise the integrity of work being performed by cutting corners. He Is extremely detailed and takes so much pride in his work! You will see it the moment you hire him. He is trustworthy, resourceful, and extremely professional. From how fair and detailed our estimates were in the beginning, to our home being left spotless at the very end; you can have confidence in all work that is done. This is so important because you do not want just anyone handling something as valuable as your home. We are very grateful for him and his company and we will use them for any future remodeling or home repair needs.

resp.text: Thank you Mrs. Winful. We really appreciate your kind words and enjoyed working with you guys so much during such an exciting time for your family.

She wanted to look up my address so I gave it to her, she says nothing came up and then she repeats again that they do not repair any one else’s blinds. Ok, so since I don’t know who, what’s wrong with charging a service charge to come repair or get a sale on new blinds. Very poor customer service and what business turns away a new paying customer.

name: Scott Vandervelde
text: I highly recommend Clay Conrad and Conrad Construction. We had him remodel 2 full bathrooms, 1 half bathroom, install kitchen counter, kitchen sink, kitchen backsplash, as well as install flooring and light fixtures. The remodel looks terrific. I had to coordinate the work with him from 9 hours away. He was very responsive and very helpful. I never felt concerned about the remodel with Clay in charge. Clay is a professional who provides high quality work. He did all of this during a pandemic and had to manage work around effects of a hurricane. I will call Clay anytime we need something done, without even obtaining a quote from anyone else.

name: Zach Melton
text: I highly recommend Conrad Construction. They provided timely and quality service even after Hurricane Sally when contractors were overrun with work. I will definitely go to them for any future repairs/renovations!

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: Had Clay and his team at Conrad Construction do a project for us and we could not be more pleased with the outcome.   Major carpentry repair, complete exterior paint and also replacement of screened porch.  Clay and his crew were professional, timely and the craftsmanship was excellent.  Highly recommend.

name: Thomas Roberts
text: Great people to work with. Shower remodel completed on time with no problems. Highly skilled craftsmen who followed up with us every step of the way to make sure the job went smoothly.

name: Richard Del Sesto
text:
Conrad Construction has performed minor maintenance on my beach rental through the years through the rental management company, but I did not deal with Clay personally until I needed his help on two larger projects.  Clay surpassed my expectations both times.  The first time was when I asked him to remove the dated ceramic floor tile and carpet in my vacation rental.  The house is on pilings and had settled quite a bit causing a very wavy floor surface.  I was not sure it could be fixed without major reconstruction.  Clay's crew came in, quickly removed the old tile and carpeting, leveled the existing floors and installed a beautiful porcelain tile.  They were exceptionally fast and efficient in getting the job done on time between beach guests.

The second time was when I asked him to address further settling issues with the concrete pad under the house which caused large areas of ponding.  Clay once again came in and quickly and efficiently framed for the new concrete, had it poured and leveled, and he did it all again between beach guests.  I have used several contractors in Gulf Shores, But Clay will be the first one I call from now on for ANY project, large or small.  Clay is professional, easy to talk to and above all, he has proven to be more than qualified and an honest contractor.  He is a rare find.

name: Chelsie Sotero
text: Clay at Conrad Construction is the best around! Always available to answer calls, any questions you have at any time, customer service is A + and their work all around is something you don't see very often! I would highly recommend anyone call & use them as you will get exactly the service you would like to receive!!! Thank you Conrad Construction for all your wonderful work!!

name: Fred Gerow
text: Clay and his crews totally transformed our old master bathroom into a modern spacious area of comfort.  They were easy to work with and very accommodating.  One of the best estimates for the job and well worth every penny.

text: I contacted Conrad Construction for a project in Guld Shores. Clay was on time and professional. The project went great and his work on the kitchen project was top notch. Their work is exceptional and their customer service is second to none. I would highly recommend Conrad Constuction for any of your home improvement needs. ( I would give 6 stars if I could)

name: DONNA HIGGINS
text: Clay did a total remodel of our condo at SeaChase in Orange Beach, AL. We are very pleased with the work. He finished on time and did everything we asked.

name: stewart whitham
text: very professional and capable. Clay Conrad exceeded our expectations for the renovation job we had.

name: Trillene Baird
text: Got the job done on time but cut lots of corners. The quality of work in areas of my complete remodel is pathetic. We had Clay do a complete remodel of a 1983 condo. He not only left us with work that needed to be redone but he did not pull permits with the city and cut corners to save on his cost. The paint and trim work is the most frustrating and disappointing of all. Areas of trim were left short in doorways and a single coat of watered down paint was “splashed “ on the walls. I paid to have the walls textured and the visual inconsistency is disgusting. There are multiple areas where the paint is not complete and behind the toilet was left unpainted too. The 1980s faceplates were left on the outlets and painted around. The outside doors were changed out but not painted either. I guess the factory primer was good enough? Same for the crown molding...factory primer again. A water leak occurred from the painter not paying attention created damage to the unit below us as well.  We had him replace the old AC unit and duct work moved from the floors to the ceiling. The power cord supplying the AC wasn’t replaced to meet code and I had to pay someone to fix the issue after the job was complete. Electrical outlets were left dead and the microwave was mounted flush under the cabinets preventing ventilation. The knobs to the faucet sink weren’t even screwed on. I’m out more money to fix what should have been taken care of by my contractor. I understand that projects don’t always come out the way you want but the texture, trim and paint job done on this job is unacceptable by anyone’s standards. I asked him to fix this but heard nothing. Therefore I’m writing this review. Hope this saves the next person from making the same mistake.

resp.text: Unbelievably difficult owner :) told me at closing they loved it and paid in full.

text: This is a great service because it’s my best friend family business!

text: In 2014 an F1 tornado came through my neighborhood destroying much of the fencing.  My neighbors and I contracted Tusco to replace the damaged fencing.  After several years some of the replaced fencing began to lean.   We contacted Tusco, who sent a representive out to investigate the problem.  He determined that some of the posts had not been treated by the company Tusco buys them from.  Tusco promptly  replaced the fence posts, making our fence new again.  We very much appreciate Tusco's response to the problem, and the professionalism of all who assisted us to include Julie in the office, Rick the supervisor / investigator, and the men who did the repair work.

text: We just purchased our home and called Kennedy and Sons because they came highly recommended over and over by friends. We were NOT disappointed!! The guys who did the work were amazing. So very professional and keeping us abreast on all they were doing.  They also were kind enough to put up with our dogs 🐕! We highly recommend Kennedy and Sons for all your structural work!!

name: Brian Mckelvey
text: Don Kennedy and Sons repaired the Lintel over my garage door. The lintel was sagging from the weight of the brick above the garage door. They installed a system they call 'Lintel Lift'. This was the best solution I found for a PERMANENT and good looking repair. It was also approved by my 2-10 Warranty company. Their installation team did the installation in less than a day and it looks perfect. They were professional and left my property in a clean state. I highly recommend them for this permanent solution for a sagging lintel.

name: Dr. Mitch Robertson
text: I contacted Kennedy and Sons regarding structural issues caused by water damaged. Kennedy and Sons immediately contacted me and scheduled and appointment to assess the damage and to estimate the cost to make repairs.. After Terry Kennedy assessed the damage, he wrote a detailed estimate of the cost of repairs for me to submit to my insurance company. He met with the insurance company's adjuster, at their request, to answer their questions regarding the work to be completed. Terry Kennedy was in close contact during the process of insurance approval and the structural work. I would highly recommend Kennedy and Sons.

name: Hannah
text: Josh and Kyle at Don Kennedy and Sons and their team did an installation of a foundation pier system and exterior drain tile system to reinforce the exterior of our home against further settling and damage and move water away from that area. The whole team was very efficient and extremely hard working. We had to adjust the plan a bit as digging revealed issues that could not have been foreseen, the whole team was flexible and rolled with the punches to get the installation completed and make sure it would function well in the long term. We would certainly call them again if we needed their services in the future.

name: Heather Woodard
text: Was very impressed with the professionalism and help that Ian provided me with over the phone. I felt like an appreciated customer and will definitely continue to do business with this company!

name: Len Burton
text: I called to get an evaluation for my foundation. Ian was professional and courteous while setting up my appointment, and answered all questions I had about the process and pricing. The team was quick and professional.

name: Li Major
text: We were very pleased with the quality of the foundation repair and lintel lift service.  The entire team - Tim, Adam, Kyle, Diego and Alex - were very professional and pleasant!  We highly recommend Don Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions.

name: Brandi Taylor
text: Ian was super helpful and friendly. He was able to answer all my questions and help me figure out a solution to my problem. Highly recommend Fon Kennedy and Sons!

name: Tim Knox
text: As a residential real estate agent my clients are faced with structural issues all the time. There is one company that I call and that is Kennedy & Sons. They are responsive, professional, and I can always count on them to be honest and reliable. When I show my clients a report with the Kennedy & Sons name on it they know they've been served by the best and can rely on the results. I highly recommend Jeff and his team for any structural issues your home may have.

name: Dakota Hancock
text: Great price, great people, and great work all around.

name: Teri Hunt
text: Kennedy and Sons performed foundation work on my home 15 years ago and did a terrific job. In the process of selling my home the inspector recommended an analysis by a structural engineer. I called Kennedy and Sons and, at no charge and within 48 hours, they sent Grant Collins to assess my home. Grant was very professional, courteous and clearly competent. I highly recommend Grant and Kennedy and Sons for this type of work. They are very good to work with and they stand by their work (even when 15 years have elapsed!).

name: Savannah Ann Bull
text: Just wanted to pass on huge kudos to your representative Grant who came out to a house we are looking to buy yesterday.  What a professional and what a nice guy!  He really put us in our comfort zone by telling us the house - basement and crawlspace - was in great shape, tight, no issues.  He did not try to sell us on things we do not need - very hard to find these days!  Grant is an honest and professional broker who WELL represents your company.  He gained you a future client yesterday as we will be back on other properties as we are real estate investors!

name: Tim Lewis
text: Don Kennedy and Sons has worked on my house twice.  The first time it was to correct a foundation "repair" that was botched by another company who would not cover their work.  Kennedy and Sons excavated the old work and tied the piers and our foundation to deep rocks in the mountain, and that part of our house has been solid ever since.  Unfortunately, a different corner of our house needed repair a couple years later, and I called Kennedy and Sons again.  They put in push piers and again tied the foundation to deep rocks.  It remains to be seen how this new work will stand the test of time, but based on the prior work, I'm confident that it will.  The price on the work was very good, and they got to it quickly and were done within a week.  They didn't mess up my property.  When they left, it was surprising to me how well they covered their work, given the amount of digging they'd done.

name: Drew Helveston
text: My wife and I are selling our house and we wanted to see if there were any issues with the foundation.  A friend referred us to Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions.  My wife called to make an appointment.  They were able to come out the following day which was amazing.  The technician who came out to our house was Grant Collins.  He arrived on time and was a joy to work with.  He took time to listen to our needs, questions, and thoughts.  After he was able to inspect the house, he met back with me and discussed his thoughts regarding our house.  He had his report emailed by the following day.   So to sum it up.  Within three days, we were able to get in touch with a expert who looked over our house, answered our questions, and sent us an emailed report.   Grant is the man and someone we would (and will) definitely recommend.
