name: James Wyatt
text:
I have to say that I am genuinely impressed with Kennedy and Sons Structural Solutions. Very innovative and, from what I can tell, a leader in the industry.  I believe their name sums it up.
Our neighbors hired Kennedy to work on their foundation last fall, and we ended up hiring them to fix the droop in the brick above our garage door that had been getting consistently worse for several years. We got estimates from two other companies and the prices were not that far apart.  The reason we chose to go with Kennedy was because of the technique proposed.  As an engineer, it just made the most sense to me. The repair was minimally invasive and took only a few days.  It is hard to find honest and reliable contractors these days, but that is what we found in Kennedy.  The finished product is better than we expected.

name: Sonya Hayes
text: Work was done in time frame. Customer service was beyond awful. The workers completely destroyed the yard beyond the need to do the work. Workers were pouring concrete (quick Crete) at 8pm using basically headlamps for light, the work was shoddy we ended having to buy equipment to smooth the surface. Work had to be redone. A worker actually came to the hospital while my husband sat with a family who was going through major family illness  to collect final payment . The work cost 20,000 and cost us at least another 3,000 to make our yard useable again. We sent a pictures via a certified letter expressing our disappointment and requesting some help in fixing the problems a phone call from the owner assuring us he wanted us to be satisfied customers, well he failed. Today after three months we have finally gotten the warranty transferred to the new home owners. This took a three hour drive on our part to see someone face to face. We were given promise after promise that we could handle this via mail. Pick a different company for your foundation work. Oh and the check my husband for warranty transfer at noon today cleared the bank before my husband drove the three hours back home. I have nothing good to say about our experience

DO NOT TRUST  DON KENNEDY AND SONS STRUCTURAL SOLUTIONS, JEFF AND HIS TEAM!!!!!

READ THE FOLLOWING SITUATION AND DECIDE FOR YOURSELF!!

COMPLAINT STARTED IN AROUND 2013 OR BEFORE THROUGH 2017

NOW AT THE END OF 2018 STILL NO REPAIRS COMPLETED

NOW ENDING 2018

3-26=17 Called your office,identified myself, and left a message for you. The young lady that I spoke to told me the best way to get in touch with you was by email.  You can call me at your earliest convenience to discuss the structural issues that still exist, a time for you to come out and/or a date for repair.

3-29-17 Ok sounds great and I am so sorry your problem did not get taken care of. My parents always said that all one can do is hire what we believe to be good Godly character and monitor the results. We did have a couple we let go since your job, and its no excuses for your job to go unsatisfied

BEWARE!!!!! Do not use Don Kennedy and Sons. They know nothing about correcting structural/ foundations. Hired them years ago, paid them and my structural issues still exist. I have been calling them to come and correct my issues and complete

Jeff,
I have to start from the beginning.  Years ago I contacted you for a specific issue. The issue was the floor area around one of my dining room corners was dipping downward. You can out assessed the issue and gave me a price to repair the issue.  You told me that my issue was repaired but it would take time to correct itself. Over what? 10 years? or close to it, the issue was never corrected or never corrected itself.  You are supposed to be the professional concerning foundations. All the work you did or what you had to do doesn't involve me. You did this, or that, MY ORIGINAL ISSUE WITH MY FLOORING STILL EXIST TODAY BUT WORST. Whatever you did under the house, has created another issue, meaning now there is a hump in another area of my flooring, which I pointed out to you. So, your text about it would take 7 working hrs under my house in April, 2017 to correct my original issue with my flooring, and the now hump in another area did and has not happened. I was here when your work team arrived and when then left. You told me while they were working under the house, you would be inside the house directing them and to make sure of leveling.  Well, you were not here to direct so none of that happened and nobody told me to call the office for anything. Attached, is where you try to blame the builder.  I hired you correct my original flooring issue well after the builder.  Your correction should have included ALL THE REPAIRS TO CORRECT my flooring issues whether it what the builder did or did not do RIGHT?  So, here we are 12 May 2017 with my original flooring issues still existing, sagging and humped flooring.  So, Where do we go from here?

name: William McNeese
text:
Don Kennedy and Sons just completed major structural repairs on a home in preparation for a home’s appraisal and inspection for closing. The work involved Foundation Support Piers under brick footings to fix cracks in brick veneer and Stable Lift Piers with 2x8 girders in the crawlspace to fix sagging floors.

Tony was referred to me by my real estate agent and he was absolutely fantastic. Tony came right on time when he said he would be there and his communications were prompt and professional. It was a pleasure to work with Tony during the proposal phase and the work itself. He is technically knowledgeable and dependable. I highly recommend him! He is the reason I contracted with Don Kennedy & Sons.

The foundation support piers did exactly what they were supposed to do. The stair step cracks in the brick closed right up as we had hoped. There was a little more impact to the yard and soil than I had expected, but not a major issue.

The Stable Lift Piers and 2x8 girders also did their job. They are not as elaborate of a solution as the adjustable “Smart Jacks” on top of poured concrete pads from AFS, but they do work and they are a little less expensive. I recommend that consumers understand what they are purchasing on major repairs like this and get someone to help if they don’t. I did an internship with a home inspector, and I have structural improvements at my main residence, so I was able to spot some minor issues which Tony readily and proactively agreed to correct once I explained them on the phone. The laborers came right over, understood my concerns, and fixed them right away. Some additional materials were added at no expense/no questions. I think if Tony had been available to inspect before I did he would have corrected these on his own. My own inspection was prematurely hurried by the office manager – see below.

Administratively this business has some improvements to make. At 2:00 on Friday I was called by the administrative assistant that my work was complete and asking for immediate payment. I kindly asked for a chance to see the work first over the weekend and that I would pay on my way to work first thing Monday morning. I was told that they would have to ask the office mgr. This made sense and I agreed. Surprisingly, Jordan called me back promptly explaining that this was not acceptable per her manager and that I needed to leave my own job and arrange for payment with Jordan ASAP. I immediately left a voice mail for Tony. Thankfully he straightened it all out. I was never given an apology by the office manager.

So, I ran over first thing Saturday morning to inspect and observed the minor corrections needed to be made. The office mgr’s insistence on paying right after they were done Friday seemed underhanded (and downright strange too), but Tony made it all right. The office manager needs to get better at being reasonable conducting business, treating people respectfully, and resolving business issues firsthand with customers. However, administrative assistant Jordan worked very hard to provide great, positive customer service. I remained with the laborers on Saturday to make sure everything was fixed to spec, and it was. The laborers worked hard and were very friendly.

I’d recommend to Don Kennedy and to their customers that a 7-10 business day payment period be part of the contract to allow the customer time to inspect repairs, Tony to inspect, and/or get a buddy to inspect after completion of the work. This will also take a lot of stress off the payment-hungry front office and the customer. I’ve contracted lots of work over the years and I’ve never been pressed for payment so urgently – despite a 50% down payment before starting the work.

In summary I do recommend Don Kennedy & Sons for residential structural repairs and especially if you work with Tony.

name: Eduard Boeckmann
text: Don's crew came out to my house and did exactly the work that i asked for and more. They did a great job!

name: Claire Roth
text:
I would not use them again and will continually tell friends and family about the headache we went through for over a week.

The construction workers are great; however, the owner and crew manager are extremely disorganized. We started calling Wednesday over a potentially huge concern. We finally halted work Monday afternoon since Todd and Jeff were not getting back to us or addressing concerns in a timely manner. Jeff's schedule miraculously cleared up to come address our concerns the very next morning--almost an entire week after first calling!

Overall, my main take away is the lack of communication, especially when spending so much money on foundation work. Our problem was misdiagnosed and we ended up owing more than the estimate as well.

I was shocked because I had heard good things and they were even suggested by our realtor. Needless to say, we're going elsewhere for additional work.

resp.text:
Hello Clair
Thanks for expressing your frustration working with my company.  It is too bad you feel the need to "continually tell friends and family" about this experience but that is certainly your right to do so.
As I discussed with your husband we certainly want to ensure that every customer we serve has a great experience.

I can not do anything to help you by posting on the internet, however,  if we can help you at all please call me directly at (256) 533-1100 and I will do anything I can to help you.

We work hard everyday to ensure the work we do is done right and that all our customers are treated well. I do apologize that we did not meet your expectations. Thank you, Jeff Kennedy Don Kennedy & Sons

name: Jake Glombowski
text: Nick refinished an old dining room table for my wife and I. We inherited table from my wife's grandmother, so it had a lot of sentimental value. The table was made with white pine and has a lot of character and curves. However, it is old and had a lot of wear and tear, so it needed a lot of work. We wanted a somewhat dark gray table to go in our new home, but we were nervous that the white pine dining table couldn't be refinished to match what we wanted and we would have to pay for a brand new table. Nick blew us away with what he was able to do to stain and darken the white pine table. It took him a couple weeks to work on it and us viewing the table's progress. It was well worth the wait, and we love our newly refinished dining room table!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words!

name: Terry Patterson
text: Nick and the rest of the guys did a fantastic job on refinishing our kitchen cabinets.  They were focused on delivering a perfect job and when the initial sanding did not meet their expectations, they re-sanded every cabinet to make it right.  They communicated well during the entire process.  They also  did a great job cleaning up after the job was completed.  I would highly recommend them for any refinishing job.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind review and for your business, we really appreciate it!

name: Robert Guzowski
text: Great quality work and craftsmanship.  I would trust them again with a family heirloom.  Great communication during the process, we couldn't have asked for more.  And they pick up and drop off to boot!  You just can't beat that.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words!

name: Grace Johnson
text: Nick and his team are very professional and great to work with and I would highly recommend them. We recently bought our first home and wanted to change the cabinet color.  The kitchen cabinets were stained a cherry-redish color, and we wanted them to be a darker espresso color. New Life Refinishing took our existing cabinets and re-stained them for a fraction of the price you might pay to reface cabinets. Nick and his team did an excellent job, and our 20 year old cabinets look almost brand new. Nick took one of our doors to try sample colors, and when we didn't like the first color, he started over and tried a different color that we liked. They really want to make sure that you are happy with the product. They taped our entire kitchen off and did a great job ensuring there was no mess. I will be using them again when I want to re-stain my bathroom cabinets.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the awesome review, we really appreciate it and your business.  Thanks!

Their attention to even the most minute detail is beyond comprehension. They even take their clean up process to the next level. Absolutely no aspect of this process was neglected. You would expect to pay a premium price for work of this caliber, but the best part, you don't! The price for all of this perfection is extremely fair and beyond reasonable. They are an absolute pleasure to work with. Oh, and did I mention that my 15 year old cabinets feel like silk...because they do! 😊

text: I had a wonderful experience with New Life Refinishing! I wanted to change my kitchen from oak to white which can be very tricky to do without looking tacky.  I found his website by doing a google search for refinishing kitchen cabinets.  Nick came over and gave me an estimate right away.  He has a very warm personality and is immediately likeable.  I knew after talking to him about his process and reviewing his photos on his website that I had found the right person to do the job.  He kept me in the loop through the whole thing.  He comes over when he says he will and calls beforehand, he finishes the job when he says he will.  He took my cabinet doors and drawer faces back to his shop and sprayed them there.  He came into my house and sprayed the actual cabinets and surrounds.  The whole process took under a week and I was amazed at how stunning the kitchen cabinets came out.  I can't stop looking at the kitchen without saying WOW!  His attention to detail and the quality and craftsmanship is beyond compare.  I would highly recommend New Life Refinishing to anyone and would ask him to do any future work!!!

text: I don't recall just how we were introduced to Nick, maybe from a newspaper insert. We called him and received an estimate to refinish an oak table with four chairs and a captain's chair, probably in excess of 25 years old with all the mars and scratches a table of that age would show, not to mention several moves while on active duty in the military.. His estimate was very reasonable, so we asked him to perform the work. To say that we were thrilled with the finished product is an extreme understatement. The set looked better than brand new. We then asked him to do a much harder job, refinishing a hard maple dining room pedestal table and four unmatching chairs (in finish and type of wood) in a stain to match a dining room china cabinet. To make matters even worse, one of the leg bases had been chewed on quite vigorously by a new puppy. Once again, Nick's work was unsurpassed and his estimate was right on. Before and after pictures can be seen on his web page. We are very pleased with his work and wouldn't ever consider anyone else for future work.

text: Couldn't be happier. I'm selling my house, and buyers wanted a lot of minor repairs on the roof before moving forward with the purchase. Stressed out, I reached out to tons of roofers, many who didn't have time for me unless I was buying a whole new roof. Not the case with 2nd2None Roofing & Construction. Bryan contacted me right away and spoke to me on the phone about what I needed done. The same day he was at my property, evaluating the situation in person, walked me through his assessment and recommendation and he was able to bring a crew out within two days and get the work done. He was straight-forward, courteous, professional, and communicative throughout the process. And, the price was definitely fair. I owe Bryan, family and the crew a huge debt of gratitude for the outstanding service, especially in such a short time frame. Not to sound cheesy or anything, but it's great when a family-owned business treats customers like family. That's how it felt. I am so looking forward to giving them my highest recommendation to any friends and family in need of roofing services.

resp.text: We are happy to see you feel this way, and thank you for your business and recommendations! Bryan

name: Jo Huffines
text: The day the third insurance inspector came to my home, Bryan, the owner met with him and he was able to explain why my roof needed to be replaced.It had been a battle up to that point. It took only 2 days for removal and installation of my new roof which is amazing because mine is very high pitch. Each day they cleaned up their debris (shingles, nails, etc..) and when the dumpster they used leaked hydraulic fluid onto my driveway, they pressure washed the spot. His crew even replaced a board on the side of my home that had a rotten spot. I cant tell you how pleased I am with the aesthetics of my new roof, not to mention how structurally sound it is. 2nd to None had the highest warranty (7 years) of all the companies I was considering which was also a deciding factor for me . Most only have a 5 years warranty and one had only 2 years. When a company can stand behind their workmanship, they deserve my business. Bryan also worked closely with me to make sure I had the right type of shingle (color, functionality). He also imparted valuable advice regarding which shingle manufactures are honoring their warranties. Also..it needs to be mentioned that before they installed the new roof, I had a portion of my old roof tarped but the wind blew it off. Of course heavy rains came and water was leaking in several spots on my roof and into my master bathroom/closet. It was raining and lightening when his crew got on my roof to retarp/stop the leakage. That was also a deciding point for me that I would be using his company for my new roof. I can tell you most companies would not have done that. Also Bryan worked diligently with my Allstate adjuster explaining the cost of the roof which they had initially underestimated. I highly recommend 2nd to None and I have been telling my coworkers/friends about his company as well.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your business and this wonderful review!!!
Bryan

name: Mack Haynes
text:
I couldn't have been happier with having 2nd2None Roofing and Construction do the inspection and roof/chimney repair work for my new home.  My realtors contacted Bryan Schram to do a detailed roof and chimney inspection for a home we put an offer on and eventually closed thereon.  We were fortunate that our realtors found a company in 2nd2None that could do both roof and chimney inspections.  I can't speak to the level of expertise of Yellow Roofing (the company the previous owner had do a second opinion and said the roof was fine); but I can tell you that I saw with my own eyes that the roof was in bad shape as noted by Bryan; and was very appreciative that 2nd2None Roofing was able to do the inspection on short notice as well schedule and complete the work so quickly after requesting the work to be done.

I called Bryan Thursday Dec 31st after closing and he was able to schedule a crew to come Wed Jan 6, 2020 and repair the chimney as well as replace the roof.  They brought in extra people and were able to get all the work done in one day because they knew it was going to rain today.

I am so thankful that they could do both roofing and chimney inspections as well as repairs.  If you need inspections and roof/chimney repair work, I would recommend using 2nd2None Roofing and Construction.

Mack
New Huntsville resident and homeowner

text: I called Bryan the owner just expecting a typical quote. I figured I would get an outrageous quote like the other two quotes we got. text: MDH Construction responded quickly, professionally measured and estimated the needs to repair my carport, and gave me an estimate with several solutions and prices so I could choose the repairs that I could afford. name: Elena Johnson
text:
March of this year we hired MDH Construction to do a foundation repair job of one of our homes. With genuine sincerity we would rate this company,  under the leadership of its owner, Mike Hayes, as "Best in Class". The group is made up of dedicated professionals and highly skilled individual driven by high quality service comittment.
The repair MDH was hired to do was one that had been previously attempted by another foundation repair company. This was our second time addressing the same problem. While the first company ensured us the fix we paid for was permanent. It was short number of years later that we began seeing signs indicating the repair was failing . We found ourselves back at square one.
At the time we did not know MDH Foundation. We did reach out to the only other company we knew of thru advertisement only, and while we had someone come out assess and quote us a price, we chose to hold off. Very impressive sales presentation they did but we were just not convinced on their proposed corrective plan.  Some time later we hear of MDH, and a lot of good things being said of the owner, Mike Hayes. Not only on their foundation repair work, but as a very highly respectable contractor too.  Earlier this year we met with a member of the MDH team, and an assessment was made. Then before the job plan was finalized, the owner, Mike, came out to thoroughly go over the plan. It was the first time we felt really comfortable about the corrective plan.  Mike has a great group of professionals and skill guys that communicate well together. They were very attentive to our concerns, explained and answered every question.  They were punctual and respective of time. Always leaving area neat after each day.  We only wish we would have found MDH Foundation Repair the first time around.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. It was a pleasure working for you! :-)

"What makes a great contractor"  I hired MDH Construction, Mike Hayes, contractor to lift a sunken garage floor that was nearly 8 inches below level.  Due to the severity of the defective slab, it broke during the lifting process.  Honesty and integrity is what separates greatness from average.  Mike realized the lifting wasn't going as planned due to unforeseen circumstances.  Instead of walking away, which most contractors would do, he  instead wasn't willing to leave my  situation in a worse condition than when he started the job.   He repaired the slab above and beyond expectations at a MORE  than fair price.  I have finally found a real contractor that puts his reputation first.  First Class in all categories.  Thank you Mike! Excellent Work!
Sincerely - Teamlott

name: RICK bierworth
text:
Open Crawlspace Encapsulation.
They have a technique to enclose an open crawlspace (i.e. pier and beam foundation) and install a dehumidifier. The underside of my house is drying out, and the moisture issues are fixed. I shopped around, and this procedure is expensive, but they seemed to be reasonably priced. They also quoted the best solution. Others wanted to install a dehumidifier under the house, but without encapsulating the underside. The dehumidifier would have been running constantly, trying to dehumidify all of Pascagoula. I have our termite people and our HVAC people come look at it, and both said that MDH did an excellent job.

resp.text: Thank you! Our team worked hard on your project.

name: Louis Barnes
text:
Roof Repairs,
I had two locations that water was leaking into my home and I made contact with Nations Roof Steep Slope in Winter Garden FL on the 5th of Oct, 2020 and the response was immediate! On the13th of Oct, 2020.  The  Service/Repair Manager (Tracy Bean) sent his team out initially to make an assessment and to provide details of the damages to me and take photos which were sent back to the office to be further analyzed. I was immediately contacted  and informed that the repairs would take one (1) day to complete and the Team would be at my home at 9:00 on Tuesday the 20th Oct, 2020.
*****The team (I failed to remember their names) arrived at 8:27am eager and ready to complete the repairs*****. Great Workers, Displayed Professionalism at all time!! They were All about Business (No Horse Playing) took the extra measure to cover the area where they had removed the shingle for repair with a tarp during an Sudden Down pour of rain.
The tar that your team used was placed meticulously, in abundance and accurately (From a Novice Point of View). Regarding the New shingles your team look like they systemically and carefully placed them properly, appears as if it was Artist at Work! True Professionals, answered all my questions and kept me updated on their progress. I would Most Definitely recommend Nations to anyone who want Professional and Thorough work conducted.
Finally, i must make mention of the Great Customer Service from Ms. Michelle Kelly, very professional and courtesy.  I will keep Nations Roof locked-in for any future needs. Thanks again for Excellent Service! Sincerely, Louis Barnes

text: Nations Roof was tasked with the repair of a pre-existing condition from The time our home was built using a different roofer.  A prior roofing vendor could not find the problem and merely hid the stain on the drywall.  Nations Roof came, analyzed the problem, found the source of the problem and fixed it.  It has only been a week and it did rain, but so far so good. I was particularly pleased with the way they went about their business to diagnose the problem.  They were courteous and professional,  reporting that there was no tar between the roof tile and the flashing, only along the sides.  It seemed effortless.  An excellent Job by Tracy Bean of the Orlando, FL offirce.

His assessment was clear and honest and his recommendations included a simple, inexpensive solution. He did not try to up sale services that weren't required, and thanks to him, we now know that our electrical setup in the basement is functional and safe. name: Debbie Greengard
text: Was awakened at 4:30AM by loud beeping noises coming from, what we thought, was our hardwired smoke alarm system. Made numerous calls to other area electricians that either couldn't come out immediately or had "dispatch fees" of $180 or higher. Saw the reviews for John's Electric and am so called we made the call. Jeremy and Jacob were at our home within 30 minutes. They were professional, courteous and friendly. They got right to work trying to solve the problem and quickly found that, not only was our carbon monoxide detector the issue, but our smoke detectors were way past their expiration date. Upon our request, they were back out first thing the next morning--right on time--replacing everything. So glad we made the call. They didn't try to upsell anything--even when we asked them to take a look at a few other electrical issues. Their prices were excellent for the replacements and installation and they didn't even charge us for the original emergency call. We experienced just how hard it can be to find good, honest businesses that can be trusted and that won't take advantage of anyone during emergency situations. We highly, highly recommend them and will be referring John's Electric Service to all our friends!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and your business!

name: David Solomon
text:
For this review, I feel I must first present a little information up front.
For the last several months I have been having issues with the plumbing in my house.  My house was built in 2007 with PVC pipe throughout.  Let’s just first say that after purchasing the home I later believed the plumbing was not installed to code, and first experienced several water leaks of which I fixed myself.

Several months ago I hired a plumber to come in and resolve a hot water (lack of) issue.  The Hot water tank had made an awful screeching noise similar to what I have been hearing in my modern GE Refrigerator with a water filter. At the time the plumber removed a check valve on the water Heater which resolved my Hot water problem and the screeching noise.  No further investigation was conducted on why the Hot water heater started having issues and I believe that repair cost me around $100.00.
So in the last couple of months I have still have that screeching with my Refrigerator and the pipes had been banging whenever we flushed one of the toilets.  Upon doing some research to try and resolve the banging pipe issues I had come across an article on a thermal expansion tank upstream from the Hot Water Heater on the Cold water line.  I located mine under the house just as the main cold water line comes in the house. The tank has a valve in it and is supposed to give a cushion for the water when it expands.  I went to check the expansion tank and when I put on an air tester, water came out, which is an indication of a faulty tank.  I purchased a new one and left the air pressure at the manufacture default and installed it.  Now my pipes started banging worse and the tank started making a sucking sound. I further researched the issue and found an article that too much water pressure can wreak havoc on your water system so I went to Lowe’s and picked up a cheap home water pressure gauge. I tested my system and found that my home was averaging around 130PSI. Based on this information resources indicated that a faulty Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) just up from the home water meter could be the culprit. I located mine by digging about a foot up from the local water meter and left it uncovered.
It was finally time for me to call a plumber as I am not one, and only completed the previous steps out of necessity.  I am a retired Enlisted Veteran and have not had a real job for six years and have been struggling to pay my bills.

The day before Christmas I called B & C Plumbing Inc. and left message on their phone system that I would be needing their services when they could work me in.  Tuesday after Christmas I received a courteous phone call from the B& C customer service and scheduled a Master Plumber to arrive at my home between 14:00 – 16:00. Shortly after that Drew the Master Plumber called me from his cell phone and said he was on his way over because he had a cancellation and would come and resolve the issue.

This is where the negative experience starts.  Drew arrived at my front door knowing the information that I had already shared previously and I shared that information with him again on what my issue was going on under the house.  His first statement to me before looking at anything was that it was going to cost me $300.00. No indication of a discount for anything or because I was a Military Vet.  Now first off, I expected that he would be crawling under my home and fix some of the issues with the bagging pipes (Non-Code meeting).  He had no time to give me a run down on what the problem was nor what it the cost layout was to fix my issues.

He proceeded to place a water pressure gauge on the outside faucet and recorded that the PSI was 145. He then went to the Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) and replaced it spending less than two hours of actual time far less work as much of the time was him on the Cell phone.

resp.text: Mr. Solomon, in response to your review I would like to apologize for your unsatisfactory experience with our company.  I would also like to state that we did not install the plumbing originally in your home in 2007.  We thank you for your comment about our courteous service manager calling and setting up your appointment.  We always offer an estimate for the cost of the repairs before any work is conducted, which you approved and paid for the work performed.   We do offer military, senior citizen, and all local law enforcement discounts, if we are informed ahead of time we can most certainly add that discount to your invoice.

name: Susan Brown
text: T.G. Roofing installed my metal roof when I built my house 13 years ago. SInce then I have had multiple leaks and cannot get them to return my phone calls or come out and look at it. I have hired another company after trying to get several roofers to come out because no one wants to touch someone else's work. FInally I got a highly rated company to come out and they took pictures and showed me where the metal was cut short in several places and patched, most all of the screws are halfway or more out, the edges are patched together causing leaks and overall the work after seeing pictures is very poor. What is really sad is that the original company is not willing to look or stand by their work. so after spending the money and putting a metal roof I now am going to have to replace the whole thing not to mention the wood in several places from the leak. They put screws in the flat part of the metal instead of in the ridges which means water is constantly running over them and slowly leaking into my house. I could understand the metal needing to be rescrewed but because they did not screw it on properly the first time in order for it to be correctly done it will have to be replaced. This company has been around a long time which is one of the reasons we chose to use them in the first place but apparently they have so much business they no longer care about the quality of their work. So sad that  a company would take advantage of people and their hard earned money. I would not recommend them to anyone.

name: Rick Harris
text:
Lisenby Construction just finished a three-week remodel of our kitchen and living room, and we could not be more pleased.  The project involved demo of some existing kitchen cabinets, replacement of a cook top and stove with a range, replacement of a vent hood, installing new kitchen lighting, laying tile, painting cabinets and bookshelves, painting trim, and painting walls.  All of this was handled by David's crew without having to sub out any work. The quality of the work done was really top-tier.  We used David's decorating consultant, Lindy, to help pick out colors, and the result has significantly brightened and beautified the two rooms where we spend most of our waking hours.

When you undertake a project that takes this much time, you quickly realize that you have invited some strangers into your home for a lengthy stay.   Well, the guys David sent did not stay strangers for very long.  They were cheerful, friendly, and helpful to us.  They added, without cost, some features to the project at our request, even though these features were not in the original contract-- for example, installing a dimmer switch in the kitchen, replacing flood lights in our dinette area so they would match the color put out by our new kitchen lighting, cutting out the trim along one wall of our living room so our bookcase could lay flat against the wall, and installing wall outlets in our bookcase.  They cleaned up after themselves every day and hauled away their own trash.  When they moved furniture around to do some painting, they always put it back where it had been.  It got to where we enjoyed having the company at our house.  At the end of the job, we were glad it was completed, but we were sorry to see the guys leave.

All the work was done with great attention to detail.  They found and installed tile to match our existing kitchen backsplash tile.  They worked on our project every weekday for three weeks.  On some days, they worked on our cabinet doors and bookcase at their shop, but on the days when they did not come, David always called us to let us know they would not be there and what they would be doing that day.

We will certainly call on Lisenby Construction if we undertake new remodeling projects.  Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you Rick for your kind words and for trusting us with your home remodeling needs!

name: Susan Schneider
text: The end product exceeded our expectations. The quality of the craftsmanship was excellent. The Lisenby team was courteous, professional and provided excellent quality work. I would recommend them to anyone anticipating a home upgrading.

resp.text: Thank you Susan! We enjoyed working with you guys! Your new Kitchen is beautiful!

name: Caitlin Singletary
text: This was our first remodel, and it could not have gone smoother! The team was easy to talk to, and they were easy to reach when we had questions. They kept us up-to-date on expectations and the timing of everything. The remodel took 4 days (from demo to completion). The team arrived early each day, and they even worked holidays. They cleaned up daily (vacuumed and cleaned stainless steel appliances). We were also impressed when working with a company they contracted with. While the other company was doing their part, the Lisenby team was present, and they made sure the job was done right/well. In fact, at one point, the Lisenby team told the other team to fix something before leaving. Overall, we were highly impressed, and we intend to work with Lisenby again in the near future when we do additional remodeling!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us work on your kitchen Caitlin, we will look forward to working with you again! And thank you referring to us as a team, we work hard on developing a team culture here.

Keith is AH-MAY-ZING! He is not just a windshield "dentist" - he is a windshield miracle worker!! My husband and I were traveling to Tuscaloosa the day before, and a rock hit the windshield of our Mercedes and instantly created about a quarter-sized "firework" (my word - not the technical one, I'm sure!) On the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend, he let us come to his house and we were ready-to-roll in about 15 minutes ... and with a windshield where I could not even identify where the crack was previously!

On another note, we had had a much smaller one previously repaired a few weeks ago, by a "big name" company. And although they were extremely nice and did a good job, I can still see where that one was located - and as I said, it was a MUCH less destructive crack than the one Keith literally erased from our windshield.

Very nice man - great work - great price - in-and-out in 15 minutes. Cannot ask for more.

text: Wimmer tank service replace my septic tank two years ago. I start to have problems with my system a year later I could not get them to come back out to my house because he told me he do the construction part not the service part .I think that is poor service I do not recommend  them.

name: Mark Paul
text: Great business, great family!

name: mark swanson
text: Best in Mobile!

name: Susan Kaplan
text: I called Keith The Plumber based on local neighborhood reviews. Dennis was very intuitive and listened. He went the extra step to ensure all my plumbing needs were taken care of and that I understood what was going on with my controlled pressure coming from the main water supply plus how it effects my entire house. I did not need a new h2o tank yet, my expansion tank was not working. Plus my leaking faucets got new interior stems and are working like new! Great experience and will refer Keith The Plumber in Dunnavant Valley as well as metro Bham and Shelby County.

name: Charlie Williams
text: I called Keith the Plumber on a Sunday with a blockage in the main sewer line between my house and the street and water backing up.  An actual person answered the phone and said that Keith would call us shortly.  We received a return phone call within 5 minutes to advise us that their plumber Patrick would be at our home within the hour.  Patrick was on time, professional, and quick to assess the problem.  Less than 10 minutes later the problem was solved and disaster was avoided.  I was very pleased with the service we received.  If something like this should happen again in the future, my first call will be to Keith the Plumber.  Yours should be too.

name: dierdriu
text:
I am so impressed with this company.  I had a significant leak. Another plumber had given me a quote over the phone for finding the leak that I could not possibly have afforded.  I found Keith the Plumber on a Google search and gave them a call.  Wes answered my call and told me that they were booked up for the day; they'd come the next day, but they'd put me on a call list in case they finished early.  And, they did.  Roger came out and immediately assessed the situation and began digging for the leaking part. He had it fixed in no time.  Everyone I have spoken to at this company, either live or over the phone, has been exceptionally courteous.

I am a single mother raising three children alone.  I just paid the funeral expenses for my father out of pocket.  There is not a lot of cash lying about at this time, and the issue with our plumbing was a humongous stressor on top of my father's loss and funeral expenses.  I can't begin to express how profoundly touched I was to encounter people who were kind, honest, and beyond reasonable.  I am not ashamed to say that I cried happy tears when I walked into my home and could run water without worrying about the leak and the rising water bill.  I will happily call on this company again when need arises, and I will be glad to recommend them to others.

name: Jennifer Templin
text: Wes along with every single technician I have had the pleasure of working with have been extremely professional, prompt and fair with their pricing. I am an HOA property manager and have used Keith the Plumber for many different types of jobs at many different communities I manage. They do a great job explaining what the issue is and correcting it in a timely manner. I highly recommend!

name: Jennifer P
text: Absolutely DO NOT use them unless you are willing to have them come out multiple times to fix more issues caused by them. I called them out for changing out my tub faucets, which led to multiples call backs to fix leaks outside the tub. I now have damage to my subflooring and vents and my car, that is parked directly under the plumbing.  Each time I was told 'everything is ok but would discover a new issue related to their work!

name: Kimberly Thompson
text: I can't say enough about their excellent service. Speedy, professional, knowledgeable, and fair pricing. I will never call anyone else but this company for my plumbing needs. From my initial phone call to completion of service, everything was handled in a 3-4 hour time frame. Roger and Patrick are consummate professionals who diagnosed our plumbing issues quickly and repaired everything without delay or difficulty. I highly recommend.

name: Jessica C.
text: Trust me, just call them and be done calling folks! I called them about 3pm as I saw water flowing through my yard. They asked if I had water, to which I told them no that I had cut it off.  I told them I could make it until morning if needed and they asked to call me back, had already heard this from several places but no one called back for several hours later....within 30 minutes I not only had a call back, but it was worked out to have someone here that day! Then, not only did they fixed the leak at hand...they tested the pressure and found a faulty pressure regulator to be the culprit and fixed the root of the problem for me. I cannot say enough great stuff about their honesty, professionalism and work ethic for treating customers like they would want to be treated!

name: Sheldon Haygood
text: They went above and beyond to take care of repairs.  Communicating every step and finishing the job in a professional and timely matter

name: Taisha Davis
text: These guys are awesome and fast. Call and the same day service was done. Yeah u got plumbing issues call Keith The Plumber

name: bonnie smith
text:
These are great guys doing a professional job.  I will definitely be using them again and would recommend them also.

Thank you so much for your prompt professional service.

Bonnie

name: Tracey Fahey
text: Dennis came out and serviced our issue with our water heater today. EXQUISITE customer service. He explained it all to me and works quickly! I’m happy to recommend this company to others and give praise to hard working master plumbers like Dennis, thank you Keith the plumber!

name: Anne Stephens
text:
I had a leaking bathroom faucet and they charged me $175  ($225 including service fee) to change a $2 rubber gasket on a stem. They quoted me the price before even diagnosing the issue, stating, "we can make this stop dripping for $175". It was a 20 minute repair job and it did not solve the problem - still leaked. I requested them to come back because it wasn't fixed and all they did was the exact same repair. This did nothing, and the faucet still leaks to this day. The plumbers were not professional, did not wear masks, and did not want to take the time to accurately diagnose and fix the issue. Instead, they looked for the easiest and quickest "fix".  I ended up having to call another plumber who was able to correctly diagnose and explain the problem to me. I might as well have thrown $225 in the trash.

Not only did the plumber waste my money, but cost me HUNDREDS. During my initial request for service, I also requested that they re-install a center knob on a shower spa sprayer that came loose. It was installed a few years ago, and nothing technically was wrong with it - the center knob just needed to be re-installed. After taking apart the cover plate and fooling with it, they said it couldn't be fixed. They never diagnosed the issue or told me what was wrong with it, offering no solution. I hired a different plumber to look at it today and he said that the metal lip on the center valve is chipped and broken from someone trying to turn it excessively to remove it (it is one piece and can't be removed). It was installed a few years ago, and no one else has fooled with it except for them. So, they chipped it when fooling with it, which explains their reluctance to fix the problem. Now the entire unit has to be replaced, I have to cut a hole in my wall, and it is going to cost me hundreds of dollars. An honest or reliable plumber would have owned up to the mistake instead of trying to brush it off, and a knowledgeable one would have known better to begin with.

I honestly never leave bad reviews. I just think that other people should be warned before dealing with this company.

name: Mike Sumner
text: I have used Keith Plumbing twice.  I have been so please with them.  Tony was great.  Will use them again.

name: Bob Barker
text:
These are the best plumbers I've ever had! Wes was great to work with and the technician was great! I could not be happier with the results and the great attitude they had.

They helped me out when my home warranty failed to send a competent plumber out so I gave Kieth The Plumber a call and they came out the SAME day I made the phone call. They got the work done quickly and efficiently. Happy customer and will use them for all my plumbing needs!

name: Mindy Moore
text: Excellent service.  Excellent work.

name: Philip Arthurs
text: They were quick to come out and they did a really good job.  They actually were coming behind repairing work a cheap plumber did wrong.  The cheap guy had pipes leaking all over the house - it was a disaster.  Keith's team came to the rescue!  No more going with a low cost plumber!  Would have saved me money in the long run going with these guys first.  Lesson learned!

name: Ted Bell
text: I had a problem with a water heater creating too much pressure. Called Keith the Plumber company and they answered the call fast no run around at all with setting up an appointment. A guy came out the same day  figured out the problem explained it well and fixed it at a fair price. Another plus was the plumber calling me 20 minutes or so before he was on his way to my house. That is a  good thing to do to keep the customer aware of when they will arrive. I recommend Keith the Plumber and will use them again.

name: Elex Harris
text: I had a DIFFERENT reputable company come to fix a leaking bathtub faucet, and they ended up quoting me $1300 and at least 5 hours of work to fix it on top of their $80 dispatch fee. What they told me didn't make sense and the price seemed way too high. I tried calling 2 different plumbing services to get a second opinion and couldn't get on the line with an actual plumber. Finally I called Keith the Plumber, and within 10 minutes, I was on the phone with Keith himself.  He was extremely nice and helpful. They came out the next day, and had the faucet repaired with all new valve stems and handles in under 45 minutes. They also charged me less than a 1/4 of what the other company quoted. I'll be using this company for any future plumbing services I need, and I highly recommend them for anyone searching for a plumber.

name: Tom Stanford
text: Excellent work! 6 stars out of 5! Down home old fashion service! Even wore those doctor things over their boots when they came thru my home! I felt like royalty! Thanks Keith

text: The plumbers were fast and very professional. They explained the issues with our well and fixed it. The office personnel where very patient and professional as well. Would recommend.

name: Fallon Bresseale
text: These guys are awesome!!! They came out to my house and fixed my horrible situation within hours!!! Would highly recommend!!

name: MICHAEL HENLEY
text: Came on a Saturday when our water heater went late in the day.  Explained things to me.  Replaced our water heater with a larger one (they did not have the smaller one with them), charging only the cost of the smaller one (so we wouldn't have to wait for another day or two, since it was at night), did NOT charge for the weekend trip charge. Saved us hundreds of dollars !!  They were very polite, very professional.  Did a GREAT job!   Arranged for us to pay over time (12 months, no interest).    Installed COMMERCIAL grade equipment!  Handled everything.  THIS is the way a quality company should be run !  I highly recommend them.

name: Curtis Brown
text: This is the second time I have used this company.  The first time was a little over a month ago for a clogged toilet. Very nice and thought they fixed problem. Called them again this past Sunday to tell them same problem again with the same toilet. The guy that answered the phone at 9:30 am was Wes, he said they were closed and seemed irritated that I would call on a Sunday even though I was looking at my receipt which stated “24 hours”.  Needless to say he was not helpful at all and I have since had a different plumber come to fix the problem. My advice would be to not use these guys especially on a Sunday or you can get the wrath of Wes. I was so offended by him that this is the only time I have ever left negative feedback on somebody.

name: Tonia Dyas
text: Way to expensive for me. Very friendly people that cane out

name: Heather Norwood
text: Moved and installed new water heater then replaced shower fixtures. Everyone was Very polite,on time, clean and fairly priced!

name: Myra Fabian
text: I cannot say enough how fortunate we are to have been referred to these guys. We had a minor crisis over the Christmas holidays - our son's gas heater regulator blew and the gas company cut off his gas until he could get it fixed. We called Keith the Plumber and actually got Keith himself on the Sunday before Christmas. He arranged for one of his techs, Bobby, to make the trip to the house, and he followed up throughout the day to check the status and advise of how to deal with the gas company. On Christmas Eve, Bobby met the gas company for us to make sure the cut-on went smoothly. Keith again followed up to let us know. He seemed genuinely concerned that my grandchildren's home have heat for Christmas. So - thank you, Keith and Bobby and all who worked behind the scenes, for making this bad situation a whole lot "less bad" than it could have been. You guys have our loyalty.

name: Jim Kelpner
text: Everytime I've called Keith the Plumber he has done amazing work and shows up on time!!!!!! Thats Huge!!!!!!  6 stars out of 5

text: Tim was prompt, efficient, responsive, and professional.  Highly recommend! Knocked out what would have taken my husband and I probably half a day or maybe a whole day in three hours! resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and for taking the time to do this review for us! Tim is definitely an asset to our team!

text: I'm a little late but a huge THANK YOU to Tim Childers with Birmingham Fast Repair for putting together our patio furniture and replacing our window blinds last month. text: I have used Bham Fast Repair on several occasions now. They always respond quickly, show up on time, and do good work for a fair price. I’ll continue to use them and highly recommend them.

name: Beverly McCutcheon
text:
TRAVIS, I got the best finally. Gave up, looked for Gutter Repair. 8 years of misery with Gutter Company that installed never could fix. Same areas. Travis has been here several times repairs and so much more. More then I can say this man has done.Truly needed him years ago. Stopped all the problems I have had for 8 years with leaking gutters, A nightmare for me. I feel rescued. Has been so great I could never say enough about him. A really nice man too I got know well as I was out there with him showing me what was wrong and needed. So where would I be now without Travis. Another person or new gutters? First day he came I was horrified what he found. Asked him do I just need new gutters again, was worried then about the whole house. He said no, he was repairing them, I needed to see what was wrong, those areas. Travis saved me a lot money and stress I have been through with the thought of new gutters and couldn’t be repaired. I will always use him.
I see now here too maybe he can clean them. Had no
Idea all the other things this company can do. Will be helpful for me too. All the great reviews and I have just gotten one of them, Travis. Must be just like him.

name: Devon Rankin
text: Hired BFP to install screens for my existing back porch. Blake contacted me the day after I submitted my request to talk through it. We communicated via text and phone after as questions came up and then Blake put together a detailed scope for the work and made great suggestions for materials to use for the job. We ran into problems sourcing the materials (very high demand!), but he kept me informed of the delay along the way and was able to begin work as soon as we had what we needed. Work was performed over a 3 day period, and Blake showed up on time and worked diligently each day. He kept me updated on his progress during the day and the end product turned out great. We can't wait to start using our newly screened porch.

resp.text: Thank you so much Devon!  We are so pleased that everything went well and will happily share your kind works with Blake!

text: BFR is the best in the business! I wish I called them sooner. Thanks Seth and Gibbs.

text: About a month ago I had posted a negative review about Birmingham Fast Repair, and I'm here to say that I was WRONG!!! Seth was such a pleasure to be around. Not only was he professional, but he took time to get to know me and my family, which went beyond my expectations. His work and craftsmanship were very impressive. He definitely knows his work and set the bar very high. I could write this review all day on how pleased we were to have him in our home and his work product. I feel like I have finally found a company that I can trust to do an Honest, and PROFESSIONAL job at an unbeatable price. Seth's work has transformed our home beyond what we thought it could look like. I would highly recommend SETH and Birmingham Fast Repair for all of your projects. They will definitely be my "go-to" company for future projects.

text: It was a pleasure working with Chris. I live out of state and own a 4 plex. One of the units were vacant and needed some paint/drywall work before being put back on the market. I can't physically be there, so he was my eyes and brought unknown issues to my attention, which he verified with pictures. I have a property management company, but their bids were high to do some of this work, which is why I shopped around and found Birmingham Fast Repair.  They also didn't catch some of the issues Chris did. My experience leads me to believe that Chris is nothing short of honest, knowledgeable, trustworthy, and hardworking. Highly recommended.

name: Josh Crago
text: Birmingham Fast Repair did a fantastic job with the long list of repairs that we had.  Luis did a great job, and works very efficiently.  I am glad that I have found my go to home improvement company for any need that arises.

resp.text: Thanks Josh! We appreciate the kind words!

name: Yuhua Zhang
text: We had our porch stairs down and I submitted a request online. Blake quickly responded and scheduled time. he came exactly on the time he promised and estimated the work. He made very clear estimate and explained in detail of the job. The price is fair. Blake did an excellent job replacing the stairs, much beyond what we have expected. He handled the job very professionally and efficiently. After the job was done, he cleaned the work place and hauled away the old stairs. We are very happy to the job he accomplished. We highly recommend Blake to who needs home repairs. He is great! We thank him again for making our home much better.

resp.text: Thank you! I’ll be sure to pass along the kind words to Blake.

name: Joy Phillips
text: We had a list of mostly small repairs to get done before listing our townhouse for sale.  Birmingham Fast Repair and Kyle Butler are such a blessing!  BFR website made it easy to get started.  Kyle made it easy to get the work finished.  We had a kitchen drawer that wouldn't close properly.  Small problem but essential to get it fixed.  Contractors weren't interested in such a small project, several "handy" guys looked at it and couldn't fix it.  Kyle fixed it within the first 20 minutes of walking through the front door!  From there he went to the squeak in the kitchen floor.  Fixed!  We needed new lattice panels on an outside storage closet.  Done!  Life is so much easier because of  Kyle and Birmingham Fast Repair.

resp.text: Thank you for kind words! We truly appreciate the feedback!

name: David Dolinger
text:
Chris Evans was my repairman and did an excellent job.  The work was paint and repair on our chimney cap so involved climbing up on the roof, screening, caulking, and rust-proof painting.  Chris arrived on time, was very nice, and worked safely and efficiently to get the job done in a timely manner.
We are very happy with his work and will call again when needed.

resp.text: Thank you David. We truly appreciate the business. And the feedback!!

name: Jeff Iftekaruddin
text: The Absolute BEST!  What a pleasure to find this terrific company in Birmingham.  Each step of my customer journey was EFFORTLESS.  Seth, Shannon and Chris made my life so much easier.  Chris is an expert handyman and is as professional as they come.  If you are looking for a company that is courteous, responsive and provides stellar work, call Birmingham Fast Repair.  I will be definitely be using them in the future! Thank you Seth, Shannon and Chris!

resp.text: Thank you Jeff for the kind words! A pleasure working with you as well!

name: Kaitlin Brown
text: This is a hidden gem of a home repair service. The variety of work they're able to do is so wonderful! I really appreciate their timeliness and professionalism with each repair.

resp.text: Thank you, thank you!

text: Luis did a great job on the handyman tasks we've given him. He started on a fence repair and has done a number of other things around the house from painting to plumbing. Seth Corbin is also a good guy. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you Aaron!

text: Tim did great work cleaning and repairing our gutters, and came out within an hour of our initial phone call. Great communication and will be happy to hire again.

resp.text: Thank you! Will pass on to Tim!

name: John Willard
text: Birmingham fast repair was so great to work with. Seth and his crew efficiently fixed the problems that we faced. Can’t wait to use BHM fast repair again.

resp.text: Thanks John! Always a pleasure to work with you.

name: Bryan Ramsey
text: It took about a month for someone to come out to do measurements (started the 2nd week of March). I was told I would be contacted 2 weeks later for an install. I understand this happened at the beginning of the COVID-19 situation and is a hard time for all of us, but I had not received any other communication or follow up from anyone. I had sent text messages on 2 occassions (a month after measurments) and no response. I'm not sure what its like in this line of work, but I was willing to spend close to $3K on the project and not a peep from anyone. This may not seem like a lot of money in this line of work, but $3K for a day or two of work I would be running to complete this job. I'm  concerned about the lack of follow-thru in communication. There are plenty of people that need work and it's disappointing to see the lack of interest.

resp.text: Bryan, I appreciate the feedback. Obviously we missed the mark on this one and I sincerely apologize. I’ll certainly look into what went wrong and make the necessary adjustments to prevent this from happening again!

name: Grace Willis
text:
Couldn't recommend anyone better! (Ask for Ethan!)

I called Birmingham Fast Repair to book a quote and possible appointment to install a pedicure chair's foot rest at my job. They were very fast and informative to book someone for us. They sent an email with a name/photo/bio/contact of who the handyman would be. He followed up the day before and day of (before the appointment).

Upon arrival he was prepared and friendly. He assessed the parts/chair and confidently installed everything exactly as needed and at a timely manner -- I commend him for agreeing to fix it, especially since he had never worked on a pedi chair (who even has?) and it's fairly complex considering there are water lines and pipes involved. He communicated everything very well.

Thank you for everything. We will definitely be recommending you all to everyone we can!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! It means so much!

name: Rebecca Barganier
text: Excellent experience. 10/10, would recommend, will use again!

resp.text: You are too kind! Thank you!

My garage door broke and I couldn’t find anyone to fix it. Between no calls being returned or a two week wait I was giving up hope it would be done. MP Garage Doors, came and not only fixed the broken spring but also saw that the bearings were bad and replace them. All done in 40 minutes. Recommend them highly.

It is SO hard to find reliable people to do work down here! So my new thing is shouting out those that I find that are worthy.

text: The torsion spring on our garage door snapped one night around midnight. Called M P Garage Doors the next day around 1pm and by 3pm, we had a working garage door at an affordable price. Staff on the phone was knowledgeable and the tech arrived in about an hour. What more could you want? Wow!

text: EXCELLENT! EXCELLENT! EXCELLENT! Quick, efficient, & professional! A job well done.

name: Valerie Edelmann
text: Absolutely the BEST customer service for any company I've EVER dealt with. Called because garage door spring broke on Friday or Saturday. Their voicemail said they would be out over New Year's holiday until Jan 2.(Weds) On Monday I got a call from Charlene saying she was just checking messages and they could come out on Weds. We had dr. appts on Weds. So Thursday was it. She had to send someone to diagnose first so she could contact the warranty people for authorization. Home warranty company was ridiculous to try to reach. Charlene reached them. Got the payment issues taken care of and called me right away on Friday. Nick and Brian came out Friday and fixed it quickly. Very fair price for what wasn't completely covered. Very nice young men who came out to install and fantastic young lady handling, scheduling, warranty, etc. THANK YOU Charlene, Nick and Brandon!!

text: Quality service! We needed gutters on the back side of our house and reviews were good for All Around The House, so we decided to contact for an estimate. text: I cannot say enough good things about All Around The House. I was in need of someone to assemble two pieces of furniture and did an internet search to find someone in my area. I found All About The House, left a voice mail, and within minutes Stephen returned my call. Luck was on my side as he had some time that same day to help me out. He and Kayla arrived on time, and they quickly got to work assembling the furniture. They worked fast but did a very thorough job, even disposing of the boxes and trash after completion. They were friendly, capable, and the price was very fair and reasonable. You never know what you are going to get when you blindly reach out to someone, and I could not be more pleased with my experience with All Around The House. I highly recommend them for your home needs!

text:
AWESOME SERVICE and AWESOME PRICES!
(Honest, integrity, fair, compassionate etc...)
The absolute BEST in town!!!!!

Hands down this company is the best in town! They try their best to save money when possible rater than trying to “up-sale” when a quick fix is an option.  Their Tech, (Chris Carr) is awesome!  He was so very helpful, considerate and professional.   Our experience with using this company on 4/13/21 has made us “Joyful Jolly Clients Forever”. If you looking for an honest company who sincerely looks for ways to help customers save money then call Jolly ONLY, you won’t be disappointed trust me.
I’d give this company 15 stars if I could as they rank far above 5 stars in every category from the first call I made to the end of the service call.
I would not just rate them “good” on their evaluation, I would rate them “great” in every category. They are all excellent and very professional.   They have made us “new customers”  for life because of customer service, quality and affordability  and we plan to tell everyone we know on Facebook and social media as word of mouth and great experience is the best advertising.
Jolly has brought back the true old fashion “customer service”  we once expected years ago that got lost over the years.  If you want to experience the traditional customer service of years ago, call JOLLY!

Simply a great company for in every single category!

text: This was by far the most pleasant and professional encounter I have ever had with a company before. The technician was super polite and extremely warm and gracious and thoroughly explained the services needed AND gave me an exact cost. It did take a little while to get together the money for him. But even then he remained very patient and extremely helpful and just so pleasant. I'll never use another HVAC service as long as Jolly is in business

resp.text: Thank you so much for your business and support of our family!

name: Jennifer Noland
text: Beware! Technician came to my house to rewire a thermostat. Once there, he told me that we had blown the transformer and fuse on the main unit and the cost at that point would be $624 to replace those 2 things and rewire the thermostat. I told him I couldn't afford that and he said "well mam I can't help you with that. There's nothing else I can do for you then." I needed my ac running so I gathered up every cent I had and told him to go ahead with the repair. He then came in and told me that the thermostat wasn't telling the unit to kick on so we must have fried the new thermostat also. He left the base plate wired up and told me that it was wired correctly and I just needed to go get a new touchpad and it would work. He is a professional and I trusted his word so I paid him the $600 and he left without it working. It was late Saturday night so I ran and got the new one first thing Sunday morning. I put it on the wall and it would not work. I had to call another repairman to come out and fix it Sunday. There was nothing wrong with the 1st thermostat. The problem was that the Jolly technician wired it wrong. Now I question everything he did that night. I feel like I paid a lot of money for absolutely nothing. I have called twice and cannot get a call back. I should have refused to pay but I trusted this guys word. I will not make that mistake again. Please be careful when dealing with this company!!!!

resp.text:
Jennifer,
We are looking into the ticket now.  We are sorry to learn that your experience with Jolly was anything less than stellar!  Someone from our office will be contacting you shortly.

name: James Lee
text: Responded quickly and took care of job.

name: Lisbeth Weinheimer
text: Very professional service with quick responsiveness to our issue.  We were out of town and our dog sitter alerted us that our AC had stopped working.  Jolly Heat and Air was recommended by a friend that had used them in the past. By the time we got home the service man was already finishing up and had restored our cooling system. It was so nice to come back to a cool home! The technician, Travis was very knowledgeable and helped us understand what was wrong with our unit. We would highly recommend Jolly to anyone who has Hvac issues.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  We are thrilled that you are pleased with our service.

name: Ronnie Causey
text: Technician was right on point and very helpful...

resp.text: Thank you for leaving a review about your experience with Jolly!  We are so pleased that you are happy with your service.

name: Lisa Getts-Folsom
text: Very nice and knowledge staff. Honest and trustworthy.

text: This company ALWAYS has sent me professional and curteous technicians. Angel answered the phone and took my call. She is always so nice! Today Ethan came in a timely manner and within 20 min had resolved the issue and left. I have used Jolly for almost ten years and wouldn't dream of choosing anyone else.

text: My appointment was from 1-4pm I called at 1:30pm and they actually had someone available to come. Russ came within 20 minutes introduced himself and in about 12 minutes has figured out what was wrong with my ac. It was pricey but it had to be done! He already had called and checked on the parts and was ready to go get them. He fixed the issues in a timely manner! Very polite and great customer service! Really great experience with jolly!

Provided a good over view of the system and items that would probably need repair in the future along with estimates so I could plan and budget for the work.  Overall great job and would recommend the company to anyone needing AC services.

text:
After a two year absolute nightmare with our home warranty company (American Home Shield) who sent Meyer’s Comfort Specialist to our home to install a new air conditioner, we now have a new unit installed by Jolly!!!  Our new unit cools fabulous!!!  There were so many things that were not up to code with our previously installed unit including a coil that was installed backwards!!!!!!!  Taylor and Travis came to our house, were there all day and answered every question that we had no matter how small they may have been.  They both worked tirelessly!!! They said our attic was the hottest of the year so far and even with that worked to make sure everything was brought to code and installed properly!!!! I can not thanks Jolly enough for their patience and understanding with these very frustrated home owners!!!!!  WE APPRECIATE YOU ALL!!!!!!! A BIG thanks to Angel too for all of the times that I called to ask a question!!!!! I WOULD RECOMMEND THEM
OVER AND OVER AGAIN!!!

resp.text: Hi Brian.  Thank you for giving us feedback about your experience with Jolly.  We did some research on the call and would like to speak with you further about how you felt about the service call.  We tried reaching out to you.  Check your inbox when you get a chance.

text: Technician was prompt kind courteous extremely knowledgeable and gave us a very good price I wouldn't go to anywhere else in town

name: Andy Maddox
text: I called Jolly early in the morning to set up appointment between 1:00 and 4:00 PM. It was around 3:30 and I was starting to wonder if they were going to miss the scheduled appointment and not call me. They called me around 3:45 to let me know that technicians were running a little late but they would definitely be coming today (I appreciated the courtesy call). Technician called me around 4:10 to let me know they were on their way. They also emailed me with a short bio on the technician and his photo. When I got home to meet them, they had already fixed the unit. Friendly, professional and didn't feel like I was getting scammed. Great experience. I will use them again in the future. Much better experience than another major HVAC contractor in Tuscaloosa. Jolly is my new "go-to" HVAC contractor in Tuscaloosa.

resp.text: Thank you so much for leaving a review for our company.  Your attention to detail and well written review will help others to know what to expect when calling for service.  We truly appreciate you!

resp.text: Thank you, Sheryl!  We appreciate your feedback.  We will be sure to share your comments with Russ.

name: Jackson Willis
text:
Very prompt service, however the promptness comes at a high price. Came first thing in the morning and fixed what they thought was the problem. $80 diagnostic and then $120 to clean the flame sensor. $120 is really high for that, but the service had already been performed before I was informed of it, so had to pay.

Left, had an issue 2 hours later. Came back quickly, which was nice, but found that the circuit board was bad on the furnace. Had to replace. Very high price that I was able to negotiate down a little bit, but now my heat works.

Great service, but at an astronomical price.

text: Very friendly and professional staff! Russ was our tech and we give him 5 stars as well! Definitely recommending Jolly to others!

text: Service came at a GREAT price. Too expensive for my budget but I had to get my air repaired asap because i was having surgery the following  day.

resp.text: Hi Annette!  I know that air conditioning repairs can be an unexpected expense so we so try and give competitive prices for our services.   There is almost always a coupon being offered to help with some of the cost to repair.  This coupon is on our website and Facebook page for use at any time.  Coupon expired? Just give us a call and we will be more than happy to work you.  Providing same day service and well- trained technicians can incur a cost that we do our best to keep as low as possible.  I get that not everyone can make the choice to use Jolly.  Our service does not work for everyone’s budget. If you decide it works for you, we’d love to have you.

text: Jolly is a great company.  Technician did great work and gave great money-saving advise. Will definitely use Jolly again n the future!

name: Julie Lewis
text: I am so thankful for Jolly Heating & Air.  I called them about a problem with my A/C unit and they were at my house within the hour. I have 2 children who would have been frozen in our cold winter if it wasn't for them coming out so quickly. Thank you for your speedy service! Will definitely use again and will recommend to anyone who needs work done quickly.

name: Anne Davis
text: The company sent a person the very same day I called with a problem. The young man was very knowledgeable and very delightful to talk with. So happy we bought our gas logs from Jolly Heating, we have enjoyed them so much!

name: Martin Agnew
text:
While in the process of selling my home, a technician came out to inspect my fully functioning unit. After leaving, my unit was no longer pushing air through the house and there was a pungent burning smell. I contacted Jolly, but no assistance was offered without a $150 service call charge plus the cost of parts, which he said would run around $2,500. He then quickly solicited me to instead consider buying a new unit from them instead of paying the $2,500 to repair the unit.

The next day I had a technician from another HVAC company come to look at the unit and they said the report Jolly had written was nearly entirely false, and the reason the unit was no longer working was because the technician from Jolly did not reconnect the blower wheel.

Not only might this affect the sale of my home, but my wife and 18 month old daughter were forced to stay somewhere else because they had no heat in the middle of December.

resp.text:
Mr. Agnew,
Anytime you have an issue with a price, you can always call the office during normal business hours and talk to our Office Manager.  She is always here willing to help.  I cannot confirm what the other company you called out found.  I trust my technicians and their expertise more than any other company.  An inspection took place and the proper pictures are on file from that inspection.  All paperwork supports the repairs noted in the inspection.

name: Julie Lewis
text: I am so thankful for Jolly Heating & Air.  I called them about a problem with my A/C unit and they were at my house within the hour. Will definitely use again and will recommend to anyone who needs work done quickly.

text:
Jun 21: Donald, Austin and Isaiah did a wonderful job on the encapsulation. From clean out to clean up the crew was polite and courteous. The crawl space is so clean now and the humidity is rocking at around 50% (even in the back corners) with 90+ humidity outside. Matthew joined Donald for the final cleanup on the door to finish out the project. Thanks, AFS!

May 21: Richard and Zach did a great job stabilizing the foundation of my house to prevent further damage. Both of these guys were hard workers and were able to complete the job in about 10 hours, including cleanup. Update:: Make sure they have finished everything before you pay. Seed and hay have not been provided to cover the soil, I had to fill in a hole left in one area myself, and I have been ghosted since I paid the invoice. Dropping my 5 stars to 4. Update #2: Important note: If there is something you don’t like, talk to the foreman who did the work and not to the sales force. 5 stars to the crew that actually did the work, 3 stars to the AFS internal and external communication process.
