name: Sherrie Rhoads
text:
Our yard has eroded over the years leaving part of our sidewalk under water with each rain, enough that we were not able to use it for hours and sometimes days in the winter time. I made an appointment with AFS.  Jason, called to verify our appointment and arrived on time.  He made an assessment of the whole landscape and explained to us our options taking into account changes we wanted to make to our property in the future.   He made recommendations to redirect water from gutters and other helpful suggestions, took time to answer all questions and explained the AFS guarantee.  He explained the process of raising the sidewalk and an appointment was made for one week later.
Brandon called ahead and arrived on time.  He asked if I had any questions and explained exactly what he would be doing.  The process took about 45 minutes and there was minimal cleanup he needed to do.
My husband and I have had work done by this company before.  The people are friendly and professional.   I would highly recommend AFS because they stand behind their work and train their people well.  Both men were just exceptional !!

resp.text: Hello Sherrie! Thank you for trusting us to provide your home with a solution! We are glad everything went well and we appreciate you taking the time out of your day to share the experience you had with us. - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

text: When Rob came out to do the initial inspection he was on time, patient and very clear in what was needed to bring my sidewalk and foundation back to normal.  He has a knack for explaining how the process works.  After agreeing to the  needed repairs we set a date.  Fast forward to the morning before selected day, rain rain rain. I received a call from Gavin telling me that in order for the prospective job to be done correctly we needed to reschedule to the following week where the weather would be conducive to a superior outcome.  I agreed... and fast forward again to the day of the job.  Gavin and Brandon show up on time and ready to work.  They explain the needed repairs, ask if I have any questions and go to town!  It was nice standing back watching two young professionals make quick work of my cracked and sagging sidewalks.  These three men are professional and courteous, they cleaned up after the repair and showed me everything they corrected and recommended a few other areas I had missed before my first appointment.  I’m happy to know they will be coming out in the near future to make it right.  Great company with a superior product! Humble gratitude to Gavin, Rob and Brandon!

text: In December 2020, I had my crawlspace fully encapsulated and sprayed with a cleaning agent.  From start to finish the process was smooth and transparent. I had a relatively simple job = small crawlspace, only moderate moisture issues, and small amounts of mold but nothing severe yet which is what I wanted to prevent.  Result = a cleaned up crawlspace that is dry and worry free.  I had one small issue after the job was done and they came out to fix promptly with no hassles no cost exactly why I went with them.......easy fix and done.

name: Betty Pierce
text:
Some years ago we needed some significant waterproofing and structural repairs done in our basement home. We contacted a few different companies to provide an Inspection and estimate. After some discussion we decided
On a company that was not on the higher side of the estimates. We felt like the fix would be pretty much the same no matter who we chose
And saving money was in our interest at the time..One company we called was a fairly well known local company A.F.S. We were familiar with them because they began here in Decatur
So we would see trucks around town. FYI,  I wanted you to know, we should’ve called AFS from the start. Today I’m here some 7 odd years later, after spending thousands of dollars with the low price alternative and my
Sump pump and drainage system doesn’t work, our walls are blistering and cracking up, down and horizontally, water is seeping thru the wall cracks and the concrete blocks are shifting and cracking our exterior brick and interior block walls. I have limited mobility and couldn’t go check on these things easily and things kept getting worse. Considering what we received from the lower priced company, we decided to call AFS to provide their opinion on our basement situation. At this point , the only thing working or effective was a dehumidifier. It was time to seek experts advice. We had previously used AFS in a limited capacity for our cracked pool deck and they performed that repair just fine and although that repair is not inexpensive,
It was much less and more quickly usable than any other options we looked at. So from there we felt we could allow them a chance to tell us (what )was happening and (why )was it happening . When the day came for the inspection, David Flamm , the inspector called our home in advance and let us know his arrival time and asked if we could sit for a few questions before beginning the inspection. He felt we would have something of value to help  determine the cause of the damage. We felt he was sincere and listened to what we had to say and even wrote down the answers. We watched as he went room to room with his big light and something like a laser . He was very thorough, and  took  pictures as he moved around the house.
One thing he did,  that most never do, is David removed his boots before walking on my clean floors. Not a big thing but it got my attention.
After the inspection inside , he explained what he would be doing outside and that my husband
Was welcome to tag along if he wanted, so he did. He was rather impressed with David’s knowledge and ability to explain the plan of repair. After our experience with another company (who did almost nothing) and David’s attitude and attention to our concerns, we were very relieved that we called AFS. He took pictures and put them on his laptop for us to clearly see the issues, he asked our opinion and waited for our response. Never did he act pushy or lacked any uncertainty about what he would do to help us. He allowed us to view video software of the repairs needed, and even priced the project as he went thru the videos. Needless to say,  we were very comfortable with Dave and could feel he really knew what the problems required. Before we had to ask, David explained AFS Warranty, Service and maintenance program and how they return and maintain the eguipment so we didn't have to worry. This was very helpful considering my physical limitations and my husband is very busy with work. We felt very reassured after spending a couple of hours with David Flamm, we had called the right company. AFS must invest a lot of time into the people that work for them, it was so smooth . We had no trouble connecting the dots. David explained the project review process they go they prior to arriving to our home and how the foreman on the job has already seen the project and all of the pictures as David and the foreman discuss the ins and outs of it. It seems every concern we had initially was addressed before we had to express it. AFS, should be the first and only call you make for your home today.
We are glad we did.

resp.text: Hello Betty! Thank you for taking time to submit a review about your experience with our company. We appreciate your thoughtful, detailed account of how we were able to deliver great results. We take tremendous care to provide the highest level of service possible during every project—and it’s awesome to be recognized for our efforts. - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

name: Patricia Flory
text:
Nathan, Garrett and Alfonso showed up at the scheduled time to begin 5 days of work to install French drains, a sump pump and dehumidifier along with a full basement crawl space encapsulation at my house. They were very prompt and courteous.  We had a small problem that Nathan brought to my attention after he and his crew started the prep work in the area which resulted in them having to remove 2 additional (early 1930's) brick support columns and level the dirt foundation under them.  Had Nathan not brought the potential problem to my attention, even with the work they were doing, I might have had more collapse in that area in the future.  Now I won't have any concerns about that.  I was very impressed with how well these 3 men worked together and also independently while completing the job.  AFS has turned an old damp 1930's basement crawl space area into a bright, clean space my grandkids could play in at my house.  The crew cleanup in my yard was spot-on.  They even hauled off those brick columns for me.  I'm looking forward to the follow-up visit in about two months to see how much more lift they can get in my (had been) sagging floors.  There was some immediate improvement when they tightened all the floor jacks and after that new dehumidifier dries up my floor rafters for a few weeks we should see even more improvement.  No more squeaky, rattling floors!!
Thank you, AFS.
Patricia

resp.text: Ms. Flory, wow, thank you for such a thorough and kind review! We are glad you are happy with the work completed on your floors and crawl space as well! Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

text: My older home is on a crawl space that had become damp -- a real mess -- and I feared the foundation might have problems.  Ben Worsham inspected the crawl space and reassured me that the foundation itself was sound.  But he did find a leaking pipe and water damage to the subfloor.  He explained those issues, providing photos of the damage for me to submit to my insurance and to provide to the plumber and the restoration company that I called to fix those problems.  He was professional, thorough, helpful and responsive to my questions.  Later, the crawl space was sprayed with a cleaning/anti-mold agent and encapsulated efficiently by Josh Brazile and his crew (Victor C. and Rafael V.), who kept me posted on their progress and patiently answered my questions.  I recommend AFS!

name: Tom Counts
text:
I had a problem with the 20 year old concrete in my carport settling and cracking. It had to be stabilized or I was going to have to totally redo the carport.  I did not know who to contact but a friend had AFS do some foundation stabilization work for him. I asked him about AFS.  I had seen the TV ads but know that anyone can do a slick tv commercial.  It turns out, the friend was positively impressed with AFS on his project. So, I made an appointment for their rep to visit.  I was still a little skeptical.  The field rep arrived on time and looked at my issue.  He suggested their concrete stabilization product.  He described how it would work and be installed.  He was not at all pushy nor did he give me any slick sales pitch.  He knew about the product, how it was installed and what it could do.  I agreed to do the project with them and made a down payment on the project.  We scheduled the job and on the agreed upon day, the installation crew arrived.  They were a little later than initially planned BUT the office called to say they were running behind, so that was not an issue.  They were maybe 30 minutes later than planned. The installation guys checked over the carport and talked over their plans with me. Then they went straight to work. They were clean cut, totally nice people to have at my home with no smoking or foul language - just hard work! There was an obvious difference to the carport when they were through.  So, I really felt good about their work.  They also cleaned up any mess that they made (a little concrete dust) with the tools they brought to the job site. Prior to this experience, I did not know this company,  other than my from friends recommendation & a TV commercial.  After my experience I would not hesitate to recommend them.
I give AFS an A+ & 5 stars!

resp.text: Mr. Counts, thank you for such a thorough review and recommendation! We are glad you had a pleasant experience and that the repair to your carport was installed to your satisfaction. Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: M Otto
text:
What a group of people and company!  I had a huge problem in my basement/crawlspace. Over the last 2 years, it has flooded during the heavy rains in January and February.  I did some research to evaluate this issue and decided to go with a reputable, established, and known company.  I was not disappointed.  Mr. David Flamm arrived at my house promptly for my initial appointment.  He was professional and personable.  After a few minutes of discussion, he understood my concerns and started his investigation.  Once he completed his investigation, he sat down my wife and I and went over his findings. His presentation of what could be done was easy to understand and follow along using the video clips on his computer. All seemed logical, but me, being the ever skeptic, asked many questions about how the system would work and why it seemed the water was infiltrating my living spaces after 7 years of no water. He answered all of my questions and his explanations made sense.  After it was all said and done, we had the Aquastop Control groundwater seepage system with Aquastop basement air system,  EZflow  tubing with the triple pump action installed.
Day of installation:
The team showed up on time for the install lead by Nick.  It had been raining a lot AGAIN and i had my makeshift sump-pump system running to dewater the area where it was building up.  The team laid down plastic tarp so as to not get my finished basement dirty and commenced to working.  It took them 2 days to complete.  What a job. When they laid in the pump system and started the pumps, the water buildup that i had my makeshift system in for, drained and did not come back.  EUREKA!!  Since this system has been in place, we continue to get the storms and flooding but my basement/crawlspace remain dry.  The system works as described and projected.  I cannot thank Dave and his team from AFS enough.  Their professionalism and concern to provide a solution to my problem was genuine and their work is top of the line. Dave's evaluation of my needs and his concern to present me with different options was genuine and without company profit in mind. I highly recommend this company and team for any issues you may have in basement or crawlspace area.  One happy customer...Mike Otto

resp.text: Mr. Otto, we are indeed pleased to hear that you are a happy customer! And, wow, thank you for sharing this with us. We are glad you had a great experience with Dave and that your basement/crawl space is dry now! Let us know if we can assist further - we'd be happy to.

name: Jeff Simmons
text:
I had mold and water seeping through my concrete block wall in basement. Due to hydrostatic pressure my walls were caving in slightly. I don’t remember the terminology  AFS uses but they came in and put what looks like a tarp over the walls.  It’s to prevent moisture and mold buildup. Life time warranty. It might be working but since my walls are covered up I am only guessing it is. After I removed everything from the walls in the basement, yes, everything, including taking out my bathroom, they jackhammered around the edge of the walls about a one foot trench. AFS then put in place , what I call a gutter. Rocks were placed around this gutter along with a moisture barrier and then concrete poured on top. Supposedly, they put holes into each concrete block on my wall and place  a pipe that goes from block to gutter. As you know, these blocks have cylinders inside where water can build up. The purpose is for water to drain from block(my wall)into the gutter then it’s to flow to corner of house where there is a sump pump.

Short story is that it’s been two years and no water has touched the sump pump. As you know the last two years have been like northwest Washington where we are getting tons of rain. Now I’m having moisture, called efflorescence, coming up where they jackhammered. AFS came by several times and put a sealer on floor. Never worked. Had another man come by and look at system to see if water was flowing properly; it was. I spoke to one of the managers and he stated there was nothing else they could do. I thought about legal action but statue of limitations had expired. $13k pretty much wasted and I’m left still trying to fix the problem.

resp.text:
Mr. Simmons,

We are sorry for your  frustration.  Making sure there is no confusion or frustration with any of our customers is vitally important to us.  We have a full time Service Department and Customer Care Club that serves no other purpose than to take care of our existing customers which you referenced with our previous visits to your home. That is something we put a lot of focus on.  If we miss you then please call us back but do look out for our call so that we can address your concern.

This was 10x better than I ever expected. AFS is the real deal. Ill never call anyone else.

name: Ben Milam
text:
AFS Review

Before you read the rest of this, please know UPFRONT that the AFS rep notified us that they PRICE MATCH!  We found this out after we notified them we had a quote from another company.  This should throw up major “red flags” to anyone reading this. Why not give you their best price up front? Now read the rest if you would like.

Stay away from AFS if you plan on getting multiple quotes.  I LOVED everything they told me and was completely impressed by their upfront professionalism.  The representative came out, did a thorough inspection and gave us a detailed layout of what needed to be done.  Where things went bad was when it was discovered that we also had another company come out, providing comparable services for a moderately better price.  As a decent human, I felt it important to contact the AFS rep to inform him of our appreciation but we were going to go with a competitor. At that point he became a high-pressured salesman and became somewhat belligerent.  To top things off, we had filed a coverable insurance claim regarding a busted drain pipe and the insurance company contacted this AFS rep and the rep told them the problem was due to an issue that is well-known not coverable by insurance.  Had I not called the rep to inform him, man-to-man, of our decision and simply “ghosted” him (a cowardly way of handling things), we wouldn’t be in the predicament.  Through this behavior and revengeful tactics, he reassured us that AFS is not the type of company we want to take care of our home.  My wife and I are teachers and work on a limited budget...we would be silly to not request more than one estimate for a job this size.  A company such as this should realize that.

resp.text:
Mr. Milam,

We appreciate your kind remarks regarding the professionalism of our inspector.  We do try to be extremely detailed and responsible with both our inspections and repair plans.  Obviously we are disappointed when a homeowner chooses to use another company, but always want folks to make a decision that they’re comfortable with.

It sounds like there was some confusion regarding a possible insurance claim that you filed.  When asked by homeowners whether a crawlspace scenario is covered by insurance, our standard reply is that ‘it depends on your policy, it’s best to contract your insurance provider’.  While we’re not an insurance company, the trend that we have seen is that acute issues like a plumbing leak may be covered, whereas issues that develop over time, like ground water seepage are typically the homeowner’s responsibility – similar to hail damage to a roof vs a roof just wearing out.

The inspection photos of your crawl space showed a pattern of mud lines on multiple walls of your crawlspace.  This is consistent with a ground water seepage challenge and why our repair plan called for drainage and a sump pump in your crawl space.  If asked what was found in our inspection, our policy is just to be candid.  We can’t really speak to causality, but just to current conditions noted.

Hope this clears up any misunderstanding and we wish you the best with your repairs.

name: Gary Pugh
text: We purchased an older home that had foundation problems that led to cracking brick and a sinking garage floor.  After researching companies that dealt with this sort of problem we called AFS.  It was a great decision.  From our initial contact to the completion of the job we dealt with professional, friendly people who always had time to answer all our questions.  Our AFS inspector Tom Bewley is great.  In spite of being very busy he always made us feel like we were important to him and made sure we knew exactly what was going on.  The repairs took two crews.  The first crew led by Luis G, working with Michael Moseley and Richard Warner installed the piers to stop the settling.  They did great work, never slowed down in spite of the rain that made a mess of everything, were always friendly and open to questions, and cleaned up the muddy mess better than I ever hoped for.  A great team of professionals.  The second team led by Gavin Dendy installed the SettleStop foam to raise the garage floor back up and stabilize it.  It was amazing to watch and they made it look effortless.  Gavin explained the process and made sure we understood and were satisfied before wrapping up and leaving.  They also cleaned up after themselves and left the garage floor cleaner than it was when they got here.  I am completely satisfied with the work they did and would recommend them to anyone who has this sort of problem.  Great work guys!

resp.text: Mr. Pugh, thank you so much for this wonderful feedback! We are very happy to hear you had a great experience, from the first call to the completed installation of the piers and concrete raising. If we can do anything else for you going forward, please feel free to contact us.

He stated that the system they use might not be the best fit for our situation. He did say that the system would definitely work but another option might be better. This kind of  honesty is quite rare with most companies. Many contractors will promise you the world but they cannot deliver. I appreciate AFS’s honesty and assistance they have provided. Although I haven’t had any work done at this point I am leaving my review based off the experience we had with the company. Even though we didn’t hire them we will use this company for any other foundation related issues in the future. Thank you.

resp.text: Mr. Walker, thank you for taking the time to review our company based on your experience with us. We take pride in providing thorough inspections and providing clear and honest reports. name: Curtis Ballard
text:
I do not write reviews and do not like people who complain; however, I cannot stress enough how poorly this company performs their work.

I called them to fix 2 drainage problems; going out the back door of my house and the other was my driveway.  When it rained the water would not drain properly in both of these locations.  AFS said that their injection program would fix both of these problems; in reality it was the start of making things much worse.  They drill a bunch of holes in the concrete and inject some material that is supposed to raise the concrete; unfortunately the whole concept is flawed.  They cannot control where this material goes as it is injected under the concrete and they are unable to correctly monitor the pressure as it goes in.  AS a result my walkway in back and my driveway ended up cracked and tilted in such a way that the problem was much worse; the water was now more directed towards my house.
AFS tried to fix the driveway by cutting a 25 foot trench in my driveway and installing a drain; unfortunately this was also done incorrectly.  The slope of the drain did not allow the water to drain out, the drain was installed with large screws going into the drain pipe, which caught leaves creating a barrier.  Additionally, the cracks they created in the driveway and improper injection of the filler material caused my driveway to sag creating a lake that does not drain at all.
AFS tried to fix the drainage problem made worse by their injection program in back by digging up part of the walkway and replacing the concrete; unfortunately, again they did not get it right.  They did not provide the proper slope to the new concrete and as a result the water make another lake immediately up against the side of my house.
So now I have worse drainage problems, my driveway looks like hell and as a result of the drainage problems the corner of my house at the garage is sagging.
I would have been much better off if they had done nothing.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Ballard, we can certainly understand your frustrations.  We are normally known for providing the most professional installations and exceptional attention to detail.  However, we regret that we missed the mark.  I’m aware that our General Manager has reached out and set up a visit with you for this Monday to address your concerns.  We thank you for the opportunity to make this right.  Have a great day Mr. Ballard.

name: John Davis
text: Very dissatisfied with the whole experience.  Had them sand blast the floor joists.  Coverage was so bad, I had to call them back and the still didn't get everything.  Also, when they removed the HVAC main duct to sand blast, which was originally suspended with metal straps, they reinstalled it using vinyl straps (and apparently not enough of them).  The weight of the main broke the straps within the first year, and the entire main is lying on the ground.  I'm appalled that they want to charge me hundreds of dollars to fix their own negligence.  I'd expect much better quality of service after spending $16,000

resp.text: Hey John, would you mind emailing your contact information to info@afsrepair.com?  We want to address this but are having difficulty pulling your information up.

name: jerake lolake
text: Nothing but pain dealing with this company.  I had to do all of the initial leg work, getting the salesman to call me back, make a quote, calling in every time - not one callback from anyone, not being listened to at all.  I had put down a deposit on some work - after the schedule date was changed without my knowledge (no one knows how that happened) I decided to cancel the work since I can't trust them.  The salesman said I would get my deposit back - no confirmation, nothing from the company at all.  I called in, shows nothing about any return of deposit.  I get the "someone will call you back" but no one ever does.  Stay far far away from this company, I'm sorry I tried to do business with them.

resp.text: Hi, Tina. We sincerely apologize for the miscommunication that led to confusion on the project, but we are happy that we were able to resolve your concerns and look forward to assisting you in the future. It is our understanding that you are now in contact with our regional manager. If you have other questions or need assistance, please reach back out to him for assistance.

name: Mike Lipscomb
text: Michael Yao  was extremely easy to work with the new exactly what he was talking about during this process for me and my family. The crew of guys he sent out which is run by another  guy named  Michael also extremely hard worker very knowledgeable very customer friendly highly recommend both of these guys. The start date came earlier   Then was quoted which was a big plus and also the work was completed on time with no complications. Will definitely recommend AFS and Michael Yao.

resp.text: Hi Mike, thank you for taking the time to write this great review! Very glad you had such a great experience from beginning to end as well. Let us know if we can do anything else for you!

name: Harry Saunders
text:
Chris Dease and his crew did a very good job, there was lot area's to figure how to install the groundwater system. They did  and I was very impressed.
There celeanup was well done.I'am very happy with three work.

resp.text: Harry, thank you for saying so! We are happy to hear you were impressed with the crew and installation.

name: Kathryn Bowen
text:
Lance Archer was very prompt in getting to our home and identifying our porch step problem. He immediately gave us an appointment time and told us what to expect.
The work was completed in due time!
We highly recommend AFS!!

resp.text: Hi Kathryn, it is always good to hear such great feedback like this! Thank you for taking the time to write this review. Very glad you had a great experience from beginning to end!

name: William Steele
text: Was very impressed with the professionalism of the staff before and after the job was complete.

resp.text: Mr. Steele, we really appreciate those kind words! Thank you! Let us know if we can be of any further assistance going forward.

name: Andrew Ramirez
text: Thank you for taking the time to thank me for taking the time to you review you.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Ramirez, thank you for taking the time to review us.

name: Sam D
text: We had our home encapsulated by AFS our inspector John Davenport did a very thorough inspection and addressed all of our issues and concerns. The crew worked very hard and were professional! It's been 6 months since we had the work done and my home is alot cleaner! the encapsulation system has eliminated almost all of the dust in my home cutting down on the time I have to clean and the mildew smell is gone! Thanks AFS I will be recommending you to friends, family and neighbors!

resp.text: WOW! Thank you so much for your kind review on your inspection with John! We are thrilled to know he was able to answer all of your questions and provide you with a thorough inspection! We are happy to hear that our AquaStop Encapsulation system has eliminated bacteria, mildew and musty smells from your home. We appreciate the recommendation and thorough review.

name: Thomas Leasher
text: Mr. Stephen Wilson helped me with everything I needed and and never pressured me into anything. Was extremely polite and knowledgeable. Would recommend him highly.

resp.text: Hello! Thank you for your kind words and review about working with Stephen. It means a lot to us to know you are happy with the work we provided to your home. Thanks again.

name: Carissa Anglin
text: We have been greatly satisfied with the work of AFS Huntsville! The crew who came out for us was always on time, very professional and knowledgeable about the job to be done. We know for certain we made the right choice when we chose AFS Huntsville!

resp.text:
Hello Carissa!
Thank you for your awesome review! Your satisfaction is our aim. We are beyond excited to hear that our team exceeded your expectations from start to finish. We are also glad that your home has been provided a solution!

name: Deborah Hankins
text: it is always a pleasure to deal with AFS. Tom Bewley is the best!! We have had AFS do 2 projects for us, a foundation repair and a retaining wall stabilization! Mr. Bewley is very knowledgeable and truly knows the business. Both crews did an amazing job! They called ahead and were on time. They did outstanding work! They took great pains to make sure that they didn't damage our yard while doing work with heavy equipment.  Other than the work they did, you couldn't tell that they were ever here. The crews were very kind and courteous. We will definitely do business with AFS again if the need arises. We highly recommend AFS!!

resp.text:
Hey Mrs. Hankins,
We sure do appreciate that you have called us not just once, but twice!  And were even more pleased that you are satisfied with both projects.  That itself is a nice testament.  Thank you for the review.  This was really nice for us to read this Monday morning.

name: Kevin McGrath
text: We had a really great experience with AFS raising sidewalks in the back and front of our house. James Carey was our AFS representative who performed the initial inspection and provided us with a quote. He and the installers couldn't have been more professional. All the details of the project were clearly spelled out before we signed the contract including a detailed drawing of the work site. The project was completed in just a few hours and the workers did a great job with cleanup. We've had some rain since then and are happy to see that water is no longer ponding where the sidewalks had sagged. Wished we had done this sooner.

resp.text: Kevin, thank you for sharing this feedback! We are glad you had such a great experience with the concrete raising installation, as well as with James and the crew!

name: Diana Davidson
text: Andrew Ramirez was the service technician who replaced my dysfunctional dehumidifier unit in my crawlspace today. I had requested Andrew because the last time he had come to my home, he found a problem that I think had been overlooked by other service technicians. He found the problem because he did an exhaustive, thorough, comprehensive evaluation. I appreciated the amount of time he took evaluating my system and my concerns on his last visit so I requested that he would be the service technician to install the dysfunctional unit. Once again, I was impressed with his professionalism, his honesty and his competency. I will be asking for Andrew to be my service representative for all future maintenance work on my AFS system.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving such a kind and comprehensive review about your Service visit with Andrew. Your thoughtful words and overall sentiment capture the type of experience we aim to provide to every customer. We are pleased to know Andrew exceeded your expectations throughout the duration of this appointment and will pass along your review to his direct manager. Thank you again.

name: Jean Lowden
text:
We had a complete Encapsulation done in our crawl space under our house. AFS from start to finish were great to deal with. Our salesman Ben Worsham was second to none. He gave us a complete rundown of the entire process we were getting. Including videos, and samples of material o be used on the job. He explained in detail every step of the process that would take place. He got us a fair price on the entire job, and made sure before we agreed to the contract that he had answered every question to our satisfaction. He was very knowledgeable, and friendly and professional.  Afte we were pleased with what he had done, set up a time for the process to be done and assigned  a crew o do the job.

The crew was very efficient, well knowledged with a formen who walked us through the process before he started to be sure we were getting everything we had agreed to on the contract. The crew foreman was Kendell, co foman Weston, and installer Chris. This crew went right to work and did a fantastic job. They had my husband go down from time to time to be sure he was satisfied with what they were doing. They were good workers and left our crawl space looking like you could if you wanted you to move into it.

We are extremely pleased with the price, the work done and the knowledge and professionalism of everyone who had anything to do with the job....

Gil & Jean Lowden of Fort Payne Alabama....

resp.text: Jean Lowden, thank you for taking the time to write this thoughtful review! We are happy to hear you were pleased with the price, knowledge and professionalism of our staff. Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance going forward.

text:

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Spears for your kind words about our owner and company. Although we did not work together on your project, we appreciate the opportunity to discuss your matters.

name: Cathey Carney
text: I live in an old historic home with a dirt basement that flooded. When I called AFS and David Flamm came out to meet me and look at the project, I knew I had called the right company. David was professional, discussed options and what my goals were. Very soon afterwards he came up with a schedule and plan of action that took about a week. The workers showed up on time, Michael Mosely I remember was so thorough and made sure all was clean at end of the day. The entire staff of workers were courteous, knowledgeable and fast. I would recommend AFS to anyone who has a home needing this work, historic or not, because they stand behind their work. David updated me throughout the process and he is a great representative of AFS.

resp.text: Hi Cathey, we really appreciate great feedback like this! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience!

name: lynda bechel
text:
AFS is a very professional company with employees who seem well-trained in what they do.  Our first contact came  and checked the problem out and explained in detail what was happening and how AFS would repair the foundation.  He was very well versed in his explaining the procedure as well as showing us on paper how it would be repaired.
The guys who came out to actually do the repair were very considerate of the surrounding plantings, etc. when they had to dig around the foundation.  We have been very pleased with the results so far...it has been less than a year, but all seems stable.

resp.text:
We truly appreciate your review and rating Lynda! Management at AFS strives to build teams that provide great service throughout your entire experience with our company. It is great to hear that our team members have done just that! Restoring your home’s foundation back to value is why we’re in business and we appreciate customers like you! Thank you for your business and time!

Thanks

name: Brian Hairston
text: The office staff and surveyors are great to work with and when they scheduled my job after making the down payment, everything was timely and I am very pleased with the outcome!

resp.text: Thank you, Brian! We really appreciate these kind words. Very glad you are happy with the work as well. Please let us know if we can assist you with anything else!

name: Jackie Campbell
text:
My husband and I were very concerned when our home began developing cracks in the sheet-rock.  It began slowly and over the years several cracks developed throughout our home.  We knew we needed to get something done to stabilize our foundation since our home is built on clay soil with a high-water table. I googled and researched different companies and contacted AFS along with others to come out and give us an estimate.  AFS proved to be the most dependable and reliable; AFS actually showed up on the date and time they were scheduled.  Michael Rosewarne was our certified foundation repair specialist.  He was excellent.  I was very impressed with Michael's knowledge and ability to make me understand what was going on with our home.  He showed me pictures and drew a diagram of what we needed for repair; he was very thorough.  He is a super nice person and is an amazing communicator.  Even after the fact, I called him, and he was very gracious, patient, and kind to walk me through activating my account with Greensky.   Our foundation repair team arrived as scheduled calling along the way to let us know their ETA.  Matt Fernandes and his crew were fantastic, super friendly, honest, and very respectful.  Matt explained everything he and his team would be doing.  Matt showed me pictures of everything they had done.  They did a superb job working diligently until they got the job exactly as it should be.  They left everything neat and in order.  I think most of the cracks in our home are already closing.  Kudos to Matt and his team.  Michael also contacted me after the work was completed making sure we were happy with the results.
AFS is clearly a great company known for its integrity because of the great people working for them, Michael Rosewarne and Matt Fernandes along with his team.

resp.text: Jackie, thank you for taking the time to write this detailed review! We are glad you had such a good experience from beginning to end with AFS! Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance going forward.

name: April Moore
text: Just wanted to leave a review on a sweet employee I met over the weekend. I was shopping in Walmart on Winchester Rd. and made small talk with a lady I saw wearing an AFS shirt. I've seen the building on Jordan Rd. several times and wondered what exactly you did. . So I asked her if she worked there. She told me she was in customer service and so we got to talking about what your company offered. I was just being curious. We stood there I know for over 10 minutes going back and forth. I decided to write you because it hasn't left my mind how passionate and proud she was over her job.... You can tell she's invested in your company. I know that you may not get reports on employees but I felt you should know that she is wearing her shirt proudly. I wanna say her name is Jennifer. I remember she has a feather tattoo on her arm. I hope that anyone who needs help will call and speak to her.  Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, April. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your interaction with our team member Jennifer—and we agree, Jenn is truly an asset to our team and we are happy to have her!

name: Dean Cockrum
text: Arrived on time and left property clean. Second time I have used this company and would recommend it over others.

resp.text: Dean, thank you for the great feedback and the recommendation! We appreciate you taking the time to write this review.

name: Bruce Bentley
text: Put supports under my house, left a big mess under and outside of house. Called to come back and fix issues, they came back but before they left told me not to ever call them back. They do not stand begin their work. I still have problems with my floor. When you hear Afs run away as fast as you can.

resp.text: Mr. Bentley, we have responded to your concerns each time you have reached out since your original floor support installation June 2012. Our company has sent certified inspectors and crew members to your home and provided a thorough inspection of your floors, finding that they are indeed stabilized. We last reached out in 2017, offering to send a manager out to inspect the floors but you did not respond to our calls and voicemails. Although you have not responded to us reaching out, we are more than happy to come look at your floors, at no charge, even though your warranty expired in 2014. We absolutely stand behind our work and can be reached at 877-340-8479.

name: Larry G Hill Jr
text:
First, I will say that the crew was professional, efficient and did an excellent job. 5 stars for the crew. The Inspector/salesman was knowledgeable and made a sales pitch, but it lacked a few details. Like telling me someone had to be present on the 1st day during the soda blasting because they needed access to the inside of the house. The whole process seemed well coordinated for them. But, well-coordinated for them doesn’t necessarily mean well-coordinated for me and I felt they were partially responsible for that due to the lack of key information and poor initial inspection. I'd give 2.5 stars if I could

When I signed up, I thought I signed up for a thorough crawlspace inspection. What my Inspector did was gather just enough information about my crawlspace to fit into his sales pitch. It’s probably best to do your own crawlspace inspection before you even call them out, because you may have to perform repairs before their crew comes out. They DO NOT employ plumbers, carpenters or electricians to handle possible crawlspace issues. They just want to sell you their system and once you sign that contract you can’t back out without paying a 15% restocking fee.

After the Inspector performed his inspection at my place, I found and had to deal with several issues. In accordance with the contract I was responsible for making sure there was power available in the crawlspace for the dehumidifier. When I go into the crawlspace to take care of this I see a wet spot from 15 feet away and realize I have a water leak. A closer look revealed I had water damage. I point blank asked that Inspector if he saw anything that required immediate attention and he said “No”. There’s no way he should have missed this. The “Inspector” did come out and look at it and he did put me in touch with a carpenter, whom I did use, and I was able to get a plumber out quickly. But, with the expense of these repairs I would have liked to have pushed out the AFS work just to let my pocket book recover and make paying for the AFS work a little less taxing. He seemed to balk at the suggestion.

Back to the power I was installing. I asked specific questions about the dehumidifier they were going to install. Where did they need power? How long is the cord for the dehumidifier? What type of plug? Etc… What he didn’t tell me was they needed 2 outlets for the job. I assumed 1 spot to plug in the dehumidifier would be sufficient, so I cleaned up an existing power connection for the sump pump in my crawlspace, making sure to leave them a spot to plug in the dehumidifier. When the crew came out on the first day they informed me they need a 2nd outlet for the pump that goes with the dehumidifier, so I’m left scrambling that night to install another outlet.

It turned out I also had a strange issue with my AC ductwork that the AFS crew reported to me on the 1st day. I’ll give the Inspector a break here and say he may or may not have discovered this if he had performed the type of inspection I expected. This turned into yet another unexpected expense on top of the carpenter and plumber. It would have been nice if the Inspector had caught all of this. I would have preferred to take care of these 3 major issues before scheduling AFS. They still would have got my business, it just would have been pushed out a month or so. The experience just left a few things to be desired. Time will tell if the work holds up.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Hill, we would like to thank you for giving our installation crew a 5 star rating.  However, we would like to apologize for your negative experience with the inspector’s initial visit.  We have a high standard of quality for providing a complete and thorough inspection, and your home should not have been an exception.  We would like the opportunity to discuss this further with you.  Please call 256-880-0670 to speak with our General Manager, we will reach out to you as well.  Thank you Mr. Hill, and have a great day.

name: Ann Marie Lang
text: AFS has done a great job on our 70 year old house several times! Dan Gordon and Gavin did a fabulous job making sure all went well! I appreciate their help and professionalism over the years!

resp.text: Thank you for continuing your service with AFS throughout the years; we truly appreciate the feedback and rating you gave our representative and crew members. We value you as a customer and appreciate your trust in our company. Michael is a great Inspector with years of experience and we are glad that he continues to provide you with great service. Francisco, Jordan and Javier work extremely hard to provide the best installation and we appreciate the great feedback on their work. Thank you again Ann for choosing AFS.

name: Robert McManus
text: We had a fairly major water issue in our crawl space at Smith Lake and I called multiple companies.  After talking to all of them and with price being a big factor, I went with the company and really the person that I trusted.  AFS is a very large company, unlike most local companies, that has the ability to stand behind what they do for the long term.  I didnt want to have to worry about one of the smaller companies going out of business and/or not giving me the ability to get to someone other than the small business owner to address issues.  Lance Archer at AFS, who has been in this business for a very long time and lives in the immediate area, was very helpful.  More than helpful, actually.  I've never had experience with anything like this before so I needed someone that could teach me what I didnt know and someone I trusted fully and Lance was that person and AFS was the company I believed could stand by their work, forever!  They are very competitive and Lance is very trustworthy.  I highly suggest anyone contact him directly to get your work done!  If you need a reference, ask Lance or someone at AFS to give you my contact information and I'd be more than happy to talk to you!  Thank you, Robert McManus

resp.text:
Mr. McManus,
Thank you for this!  Each point that you noted is exactly what we want our customers to walk away with once we have met with them and worked with them.  We are not who we are without people like you reaching out to us and allowing us to work on their home.  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review and rating. Welcome to the AFS family.

name: Michael Robinson
text: Justin, Brandon, & Gavin

resp.text: Hi Michael! We appreciate you taking the time to share this review. We'll be sure to share with each team member! - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

name: Mark Frazier
text: Was told I needed $32,000 in repairs to my foundation.. got a second opinion from Affordable Foundation in Hartselle.. $0.00 My foundation is just fine..

resp.text: Mr. Frazier, if you start seeing the problems worsen even more, please reach out to us if we can help.

name: Joe Jackson
text: Keith Laney promised to inspect a property I was buying on Wednesday . When he did not show up, I texted him, No reply, later I called him and he said he will be there by the end of the Thursday and no later than Friday morning. He didn't show up. Keith has not responded to my text. A week and a half later (still no reply) I call Jennifer at AFS. I told her what happened and asked for another inspector. She said they didn't have one and all she could do was say Sorry. Hell of a way to run a business.

name: Charles Stagg
text: Our crew was Francisco (Forman), Matt and Jose were very professional and pleasant to work with.  They explained what they were doing and how it would improve and protect our foundation.  They carefully removed and replaced our plants and made the area look as if they had not been there.  We were very pleased with their work.

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and review Charles! We are happy to hear that Francisco, Matt & Jose performed up to your expectations and were careful with your property. We truly appreciate your trust in our company and for allowing us to improve and protect your foundation. Thank you!

name: Carlos Fletcher
text:
It's been a year. I can't see where they fixed my problem, actually I think they just took $13,000 dollars from me. Called them out here 3 times and I still have water under the house, and the worker evidently turned the humidifier off alongwith the alarm, to pacific me! Terrible expensive experience, I should have spent less money revamping my yard 😡😡😡😡😡😡

This company need more competition! They returned and did some extended work but I still put out sand bags to keep water from getting under the house. Payed $13,000 and they haven't returned to service the equipment not one time! I thought they would for the first year, but I guess I've got to buy into the service plan. More money. But there's a lifetime guarantee on the work. I guess I'm a single lady and I just don't get how this stuff works.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Fletcher, please give our office a call, we’d like to talk to you about the issues you stated above. We strive to make sure every customer is satisfied with the services. Please call our service department at your convenience, 877-340-8479.

text: Steven Wilson helped us out tremendously. He is kind , courteous , honest, very professional and answered all of our questions . I would HIGHLY recommend him!

name: Britney Walker
text: After dealing with some REALLY horrible foundation companies, David Flamm from AFS came to do an inspection of our home, and he was a breath of fresh air. He spent 2+ hours inspecting the inside, outside, and underneath our house. He gave us a very detailed report, then came out again on the weekend just to talk to my husband and show us short videos of how the products work. He was very professional, and you could tell he really cares about his customers. We hired AFS to do some work and needless to say, when you come home and see your yard/front porch torn up, you might start to panic. However, the onsite crew put my mind at ease and assured me once they put the top-of-the-line helical piers in, they would restore the concrete, landscaping, mulch, etc. exactly how it was before (or until I was 100% satisfied) at no extra cost. They lived up to their word, and what even impressed me more was that they finished the entire job in a single day. These guys are such honest and hard workers! You can tell the whole AFS team is well-trained. Keep up the good work!

resp.text: Mrs. Walker, we greatly appreciate your feedback, as well as your trust in AFS to complete your foundation repair project! We are happy to hear that you've had a remarkable experience with David, the installation crew, and our company as a whole. We appreciate the opportunity to work with you and your husband after you both had not so pleasant experiences with other companies. Thank you again.

name: Robert Hendrix
text:
I contacted AFS not knowing much about the company, except what I was exposed to on TV and the internet. I needed work done on my house foundation and my son-in-law of Huntsville Heating and cooling, Christopher Hayden said that he had heard the company did good work.
David Rathmann of AFS responded to my call and we discussed what needed to be done and he explained the ins and outs of how it could be done and then let me make the decision on what I thought I needed and he made suggestions along the way. So it was decided I would have the work done.
On the two days the pier crew arrived, the crew chief Javier greeted me and we discussed the work progress and what they were doing each day.  Javier was ready to explain anything I was unsure about, with a short discussion on my expectations he and his crew was ready to get started. I have been around crews, and know how hard it is to get everyone going but without hesitation the crew was assigned work and they really got started. Along the way as I watched each of the crew was ready to explain what they were doing and why. It was great to see a crew that was self starting and knew their job so it could be accomplished with little delay. The second day the crew members changed a bit, but still  Javier was the crew chief, and again they started work soon after they arrived without delay and some conversations occurred at times to make sure what they were doing was the right way, because the situation of this repair was a little unusual, but they adapted to keep the work on time and with a professional attitude.
The third day the poly crew chief,  Dendy and crew arrived on time and immediately Dendy greeted me and explained what they were here for and ask to be shown the work area.  We discussed what he was going to do and how it would be accomplished and without delay, they got started preparing for the job of the day. They were always willing to explain the procedure and the expected results, and also how they would attempt to prevent any unwanted results.
I want to commend all the personnel for their excellent work and their professionalism and accepting my sometimes unneeded suggestions and allowing me to express myself.
Thank you AFS for having happy crews, apparently they like working for AFS and proudly say so with a strong sense of belonging to a company who apparently cares about their employees.

Robert Hendrix
A  Satisfied Customer.

resp.text: Mr. Hendrix, we greatly appreciate your feedback, as well as your trust in AFS to complete your repair project! We are in the business to take care of our customers and are glad to hear about your satisfaction from the beginning to the end of your project. We are happy to hear that you've had a remarkable experience with your Inspector, Dave; Foreman, Javier; Poly Foreman, Gavin and our company as a whole. We welcome you to the AFS family and are here if you need any assistance in the future. Thank you.

name: Laura Turner
text: I went with the Painting Company because they were the lowest bid. What a mistake. It took them two months to come paint the house and then a week to complete the job. The first day, a foreman came by, but just have me sign some papers. He immediately left and just one painter remained. There was a woman (who was never introduced to me) who came for part of the days, but she wasn't always there. There was no oversight of the painter. He was very polite, but sloppy and didn't want to do all the work that was quoted. There were paint drips everywhere, missed spots, and worst of all, splatters on on my tile floors that do not want to come up. I would not use the Painting Company again.

resp.text: We regret you had a negative experience with our company. We have several painting crews and work diligently to complete our customers projects as soon as possible. During the spring and summer months our schedule does fill up quickly and we do book out a month or two. Some of our larger crews will spilt into 2 person crews in order to reduce the wait for upcoming projects. That is what occurred with your project. The foreman had split his team and was covering two projects at the same time. These jobs are also visited multiple times by our production manager. This particular job was visited several times by the production manager who was not made aware of the complaints. Our foreman also did a walkthrough with the homeowner at the end of a project at which time any problem areas are addressed and the project is signed off by the customer. Unfortunately, we were unaware of problems with your project until this post. Once we were made aware, we contacted you to rectify the problem areas but the home had been sold.

name: Jimmy Lauderdale
text:
Read this review..............
We needed the inside of our home painted,  The entire inside, all the walls and ceilings in every room.  After 20+ years and doing touch up painting as needed, we had to do more and that involved changing colors in about 70% of the house.

We did our due diligence and got three estimates from reputable painters.  The first came in roughly $4000 over our budget and we began to consider just painting the main level.  The second (who we had used in the past) was only $200 over budget, had done good work for us in the past and we were now in a comfortable price range.  The Painting Company was the last we called and came highly recommended by several friends and neighbors.

When Peter and I completed our walk through, he handed me a nice glossy folder containing references, insurance information, standard practices and the like.  We had also discussed upgrading from a contractor grade paint to something better (especially since we are known to only paint when its an absolute necessity).  Peter was courteous and professional and as he drove off, I knew we could never afford what we had discussed.

The bid from the Painting Co came in the next day and was $1600 under budget ($1800 under the next closest bid and $5600 under the high bid).  I read through the detailed list of inclusions and exclusions, the color choices in the different rooms, the type and manufacturer of paint to be used and found it all to be exactly as discussed the day earlier.  We had found ourselves a painter.

We called and set up a date to start, game them a 25% deposit to cover material and began taking down pictures and putting away breakables.

A little over a week later, two painters showed up at the house as scheduled.  They may have been 10 or 15 minutes late.  But, that was all.  The date was correct and they had all their gear and were ready to go.  We walked through the house marking which rooms were to be painted which colors to avoid any confusion or misunderstanding and they began moving furniture, taping the trim and covering everything (and I mean everything.  our house looked like a drop cloth bomb had exploded in it).

That day and part of the next were ceiling days and they began some of the upstairs walls.  The next day the upstairs was complete and they brought the show to the main level.  Three and a half days after beginning, they were cleaning up the house, we did a final walk through, some light touch up and they replaced the furniture before leaving.

They had estimated four to five days and finished in three and a half and the product was nothing short of excellent.  I was contacted promptly when they had the one question that required a minimal amount of homeowner guidance.

It's been a week now and every time we walk into a room we are still amazed by the quality of work and the difference that it makes.  I guess it's time to start planning the painting of the outside again.  The Painting Company will get the job.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the incredibly detailed 5-Star Review, Jimmy!

name: Sandra Short
text: They painted my house onside and out. At first I was happy with it for a week or so and then I started finding unpainted places, peeling paint ..they came back out and painted the unpainted places and repainted where the paint was peeling off bit it was raining the day they came out and now the paint has run and bubbled up.  Now I fiND I can't raise my windows upstairs because they painted them shut.  I will not use them again

resp.text: Sandra.  We have a 3 year warranty so you can call at anytime and we can fix any problems that may arise.  Sometimes in the south with the humidity, windows will stick and they just need a little help to be opened.

name: Tony Sacco
text: They did a good job and they did it fast.  No surprises.  Very fair price.  We had 3 estimates and they had a slightly lower price than the others with the same type of process and paint.  Only minor concern is that they don't have a manager come out to inspect the job after completion.  As the homeowner or client it's up to you to inspect and then sign off that the job is complete.  I spotted a couple minor issues upon my initial review before signing off and they took care of it.  Since then I've spotted a couple more very minor issues that I can handle.  I just think if they had a manager or designated professional inspect the job upon completion they would see things I missed.  That being said, they did a very good job, very quickly at a good price and I would use them again.

name: Cory Sims
text: Met to go over work needed and never received a quote for what it would cost. Never heard anything back.

resp.text: Cory. Just making sure you received that quote. I know it got sent out again. Please let us know. Thx!1

name: Scott Ryan
text: Arizona Painting company did an awesome job.  The quote was less then expected.  And the quality and time to finish the job was outstanding.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-Star review, Scott!

name: Glover Pope
text: In 15 years, I have only given 2 bad reviews online.  The first was Heartland Rentals of Gatlinburg in 2002 and now The Painting Company of Birmingham.  Companies and people make mistakes.  Those things can be fixed.  A lack of ethics is something else entirely.  I am questioning the legitimacy of the good reviews on this site. There are not enough characters  to give you all of the details.  They overcharged, lied and manipulated the contract.  I will post the details on my website  and insert a link for all to view if interested.

name: Ted Darby
text: Can not give a rating because they are doing so much business they can only come out between 9am and 3pm to give a quote. ?? Rather restrictive a time span to say the least. When told I could not take off during that time and could only be there by 4pm, they did not seem very interested in getting my business. Oh well, their loss. I pay cash.

name: Lahoma Worley
text: Although there were some miscommunications regarding dates and amount of time needed for completion, Luis and his team were very professional,  courteous,  prompt and did a nice job.

resp.text: Thanks Lahoma for your patience, business and your great review!!  We really appreciate it.

name: mark picogna
text: they painted all of the outside of my house they did a great job so when i'm ready to do the inside they will do it also thanks to the crew for the great work.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-Star Review Mark!

name: Dean LaFollette
text: The Painting Company was quick and professional.  They accommodated my availability and painted the entire interior of my new house in less than two days.  I found their price to be reasonable and could not be happier with the results!

resp.text:
Hi Dean,

Thank you for choosing The Painting Company of Birmingham. We value your feedback and we are very glad that you're pleased with the results of your most recent painting project with us.

Thank you from The Painting Company of Birmingham!

name: Emily Zanthos
text: Highly recommend! Very professional and fast workers. Will definitely use again!!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-Star Review, Emily!

name: Garrett Hurst
text: Great company, easy to deal with and excellent quality work repairing and painting all of our exterior trim!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Garrett!

name: Jeremiah Millington
text: Very pleased with the work done by The Painting Company.  The guys were very professional and offered tremendous advice that helped move the project along.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-Star Review, Jeremiah!

name: david bintz
text:
The basic painting of the home went ok, BUT a drywall repair on my front porch has been a disaster.  First repair,r the spackling was not dry, but was painted over anyway.  The seam drooped and looked terrible.  Painter came back to repair a week later.  Second repair the paint does not cover the white repair AND you can see exactly where he rolled the paint.
I refused to have the same person TRY again.  So still looks terrible, but will have someone else fix.
I got the sloppy/lazy contractor..... all his supplies were in a pile in the van, could not figure how he finds anything.  Used his foot to move the rocks landscaping back up next to the house.  I fixed that after, since it looked like someone used their foot.
Would not recommend this company, although I know others that had a great experience.  Just depends on which sub-contractor/painter you get.

name: Darrell Blackburn
text: Guys did a great job. I would/will use them again.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review, Darrell!

name: Luann Lee Brown
text: I was pleased with the job done, paint used and the courtesy and customer service provided.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-Star Review, Luann!

name: Grant DeJong
text: This is in response to Sharon the School Teacher's review.  Sharon we do estimates after 3:30pm so there must have been some misunderstanding.  My guess is that we didn't have any later spots available that worked for your schedule.  Our apologies.

name: David Smith
text: Crook

resp.text: David, Thanks for your patience, we now have proper admin available to reply to reviews, questions, and comments online. We are sorry to hear you have had a negative experience regarding our work here at The Painting Company of Birmingham. We'd love to speak with you regarding this feedback to try and resolve the issue. Please give us a call at (205) 995-5559 and we'll be happy to assist you further.

name: Kalvin Kendrick
text: Sneaky

name: Mike Floyd
text: Did a great job painting the interior of an empty house, but left the carpets and wood flooring dirty. Left window locks off wooden windows and knobs off closet doors.

name: John Savarese
text: Average job. Paint runs in numerous spots, every single socket and light switch had to be scraped to remove paint, got paint on the carpet and hardwood floors.

name: Jeffery Lusk
text: The most awesome place that ever was

name: Terri Jo Livingston
text: Across the street at 8253a howells ferry rd. Semmes al. 36575

name: Mark Martin
text: They went over and above expectations!!!! Not only fixed the roof but replaced rotten wood for the same price. If you hire them you will not be taken!! Very dependable!!!

resp.text: We're so glad we could help out, Mark, and it's great to hear with left you with a great impression. If there's anything else you need, don't hesitate to reach out. -Steve White, Owner

name: Bruce Pajak
text: I needed my eaves worked,and replaced as needed so I guess that wasn't enough for their time so they weren't interested

resp.text: I'm very sorry we weren't able to help with your eaves this time, Bruce, and that you didn't feel worth our time. If you can, please call us at (205) 942-8374 -- I'm eager to talk with you more about this. -Steve White, Owner

name: Kate Johnson
text: Steve White was at my house within 20 minutes of my first call about a leak. Because of the debris on my roof—which he cleaned off—he was not able to diagnose the problem that day, so he came back after the next rain a few days later and found and fixed the leak, and I've had no further problems. I found Steve to be dependable, informative, and hardworking, with very reasonable rates as well. Will definitely use Bill White Roofing again next time I need roofing services.

resp.text: Thank you Kate!  I'm glad we could get the leak taken care of.

name: Fred South
text: THEY WERE A NO SHOW. NO CALL NO NOTHING.

resp.text: Fred, it's disappointing to see this review, and we apologize for any inconvenience. This certainly doesn't sound like us, so we hope you'll reach out directly and give us a call to discuss this further. -Steve White, Owner

name: Julie Mezzell
text: Steve White is the greatest! They put a roof on 8 years ago. Very professional. Roof looks great and workmanship is excellent. Twice after major storms Steve has come out and checked the roof for damage. He adds tar, puts nails in and makes sure all shingles are in place and does not charge us. I recommend Bill White roofing and will use them again!

resp.text: Thanks, Julie!  We appreciate you!

name: Ted Cook
text:
Bill White Roofing is the company to use.
Steve White and his crew are very detailed in
their work and are concerned with doing the
job correctly at a fair price. They were easy to
deal with and made it a hassle free process.
Great roofing company.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Mr. Cook!  We appreciate your business!

name: Thomas Head
text: Bill White Roofing & Specialty Company exceeded our expectations when replacing our roof, installing a sky light, replacing soffit, repairing dormers and rebuilding our chimney. Steve White, the project manager, has a keen eye for detail and he ensured that our new roof, dormers, and chimney were securely wrapped and protected and all materials were thoroughly, professionally installed. He kept us informed on how the project was progressing. If a problem arose during the project, Steve took the time to explain in detail the problem and what options were available. His team was dependable and professional and we are very pleased with their quality of workmanship. Each and every day, Steve’s team arrived when we expected them and thoroughly cleaned up all areas before leaving. We met with many roofers and contractors, as well as, reviewed many bids before deciding on Bill White Roofing & Specialty Co. They reasonably priced our project and they came highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Head!  We enjoyed working on your roofing project.  Please let us know if we can do anything else for you in the future.

name: John Godsey
text: We just had Bill White Roofing replace our Roof & Gutters. Steve White is the ultimate professional & the work performed was done timely & on budget - It looks beautiful & we have No more leaks. I highly recommend Bill White Roofing -

resp.text: Thanks for the nice words, John!  We appreciate your business!

name: Dianne B
text: Mr. White repaired a damaged area on my porch roof.  His crew arrived when they said they would be there, Mr. White checked in several times to supervise the repair, and everything was cleaned up when they left.  I was very pleased with the work and would use this roofing company again.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Dianne.  We appreciate your business and would love to help you in the future with any other roofing needs.

name: Natalie McGee
text: Did an excellent roofing job and cleanup! Even trimmed a couple of limbs overhanging my roof. I recommend them highly

resp.text: Thank you!  We appreciate your business!

name: Christy Gravitt
text: They were amazing and cost effective and timely

resp.text: Thanks for the review Christy and I really liked your dewalt blower , I’m gonna have to get one of those.

name: Mark David Roberts
text:
Bill White Roofing is the company that fixed the roof at my apartment. Steve White arrived personally to inspect and repair the damage. It was the Saturday before Thanksgiving this year.

He fixed the problem that was causing water to drip into our child's bedroom. Speaking with Steve afterwards, I am confident that he performs quality work and is a man of his word.

name: paul jung
text: I was selling my home in Haddon (Ross Bridge) and needed to get some repairs done.  Steve gave the most competitive price, and he (along with 2 workers) did an excellent job.  Steve also took care of a couple other things to boot!

resp.text: We were happy to get your repairs handled, Paul! Thanks for the kind words. -Steve White, Owner

name: James Harris
text: Great service and fair price for repairs to my storm damaged roof.  Really top notch folks!

name: John Garwick
text:
Good people
Easy to work with as far as explaining priorities of necessary repairs
Very good pricing
My wife loved that they cleaned up so well she was not sure they had been there yet.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!  We appreciate your business and are glad we could help!

name: Frank Watkins
text: Fantastic employees and they did a wonderful job

resp.text: Thank you Mr. and Mrs Watkins

name: Robert E
text: We selected Bill White Roofing (Steve White) to put a new roof on our home and replace the rotten boards, which included some facia, soffit, cornice, trim and sheathing boards.   Steve also corrected a water trap area.   Finally, we elected to replace the gutters and install ridgeline/soffit vents to our older home.  On Steve Whites initial visit, he listened to our concerns and needs and did a thorough roof inspection.  He came off the roof and laid out what and how his team would complete the work, which also included the quality of materials they use beyond just the shingles/paper itself.   All the work was done by Steve and his crew.  We were most pleased and recommend you give Bill White Roofing (Steve White) a call if you have roof issues.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Robert.  We greatly appreciate your business!

name: Ethan Difatta
text: Great work.  Professional.  Did the job right.  Cleaned up the yard afterwards.

resp.text: Thank you!  We appreciate your business!
